Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Lex81
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Pantages three months ago. Four days before my trip they called to let me know they don't have the type of room I need. I will not be staying here, now or ever. That is terrible customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service, Sub-Par Rooms”
Reviews.Author: WinstonBR
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay at the Pantages Hotel as we had a family event in town. It was one of the worst hotel experiences I've ever had. The location is great, but that is about the only good thing I can say about it. From check in to check out, it was far from the "boutique experience" that Pantages so proudly advertises. The staff were completely indifferent to guest experience. I heard other people complaining as well, so it wasn't just us. At times, the staff were extremely rude. It was so bad and offensive that we complained to the Manager, who in turn offered us free parking. That was nice, but not enough to make me ever want to come back. Our room was clean, but worn. The Pantages website raves of their luxurious jacuzzi tubs, but our jets were broken. Light bulbs were out. When I plugged my hair dryer into an outlet, it blew it up and broke it. All in all, definitely sub-par. I will never stay at Pantages again and do not recommend anyone else stay there either.

Reviews.Title: “Nice weekend away!”
Reviews.Author: Chris M
Reviews.Content: Pleased with this hotel stay overall. Great central downtown location, across from the Eaton's Centre. We took advantage of a "Shopping Package" which included a $50 gift card to the mall across the street, and also included free parking (which depending on the location downtown is worth like $40). Hotel staff allowed for an early check in so that we could get to the mall and get our car parked, bags inside and get to the downtown shopping and restaurants. Spa on site, provided good service and atmosphere. Small little Martini Bar onsite, with plenty of drink choices to choose from, and also had a piano bar. Room was very spacious and had everything one would need for a short weekend stay. Only area of improvement would be the internet service, it was available but for an extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique wannabe”
Reviews.Author: Sylvie-Catherine
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd stay at the Pantages Hotel. The decor is modern, streamlined, very much like a boutique hotel. The rooms are spacious, comfortable. Love the location: Very close to the Eaton Centre, theatres. Great value for the money. But the Pantages lacks the attention to detail generally associated with boutique hotels. Every time I stay there, I can't help but notice little maintenance slip ups: chipped paint, cracks in the sinks... Nothing major but just falling short of boutique standards. And another thing: Breakfast starting at 7 on a weekday morning? That's just too late for this business traveller. All in all though, I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique charm; great location”
Reviews.Author: So_much_to_see084
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Pantages Hotel, a classy little boutique hotel adjacent to Massey Hall and the Pantages/Canon/Ed Mirvish theatre, a stone's throw from the Eaton Centre and Dundas Square. Rooms are nicely done in muted neutrals with well done photos of Toronto highlights. Glass wine and water glasses (much more rare in hotels than they should be!). Lobby bar with gas fireplace and weekend piano entertainer. Service throughout our stay was efficient and professional, Spa services available on the same floor as the fitness centre. Pricey unless you can snag a deal, but well worth it if you can.

Reviews.Title: “A chance to relax and get recharged.”
Reviews.Author: Eclectic67
Reviews.Content: Even in the middle of a big city you can find peace, relaxation and a getaway. The Pantages Hotel is in the middle of the theater district of downtown Toronto. Walking distance to some of the best jazz clubs in town, the finest restaurants, and shopping. But in the hotel is where you will find your best time. The Shizen Spa offers decadence for both the female clients but also a great retreat for us guys too. It is a nice stay with only one complaint that it is an old hotel that could use some work to bring it up to date. If you are looking for a nice weekend getaway then I highly suggest this hotel and mostly the use of the spa. I will be back a few times this year.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: anmejoshme
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the weekend and really enjoyed this hotel. The doorman greeted us by name on our arrival and remembered it- WOW! (good at reading luggage tags because we didn't give him our name), friendly staff on check in and when we went in and out. The hotel has a very small lobby, a nice lounge where you can get breakfast in the morning and in the evening they had a light menu, drinks, live entertainment on the weekends. We enjoyed sitting by the fireplace by the windows, having a drink and dessert while watching the world walking by. Also on the main floor is a 'living room/library' type area where it is quiet and great for small groups to congregate. The rooms are on the 10-17th floors. The rest of the building is condos but the elevators are for hotel floors only. Only a few rooms on each floor so we had no hallway noise. The rooms are spacious with really odd shapes. Lots of light from the windows, but being in downtown in the heart of the city, the views are mainly street or the building directly across. The rooms were well maintained. Standard bathrooms but nice showerhead. Kitchen is well laid out. Washer and dryer in unit. Free wifi. Older style televisions which was surprising considering everything else was so updated. Beds were very comfortable. Pull out couch is fine for kids or teens, not great for adults for sleeping on as the mattress is quite thin. There is a small gym for hotel guests and a very nice spa with hot tub and saunas as well as treatments. The only downside was that on check out, the wonderful attentive staff who had worked all weekend had been replaced with someone with a less enthusiastic attitude. There is no restaurant on site (just the food served at the lounge) but on the corner in the same building is Fran's Diner, an icon in Toronto which has great prices. It has a separate entrance from the hotel. The location is excellent for those wanting to be in the heart of the action (but without the noise we have often experienced staying in other nearby hotels). Steps from the Eatons centre and 10minute walk to the St. Lawrence Market and waterfront area. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Fotodaze
Reviews.Content: The hotel is central and attached to a 24 hour cafe next door. The room was comfortable though the lighting is poor, much like Paris hotels, making it difficult to read in bed. Room was comfortable and the bed firm. Charged $12.00 a day extra for wifi in the room, but free in the small lobby. All in all a good value for the money. Of course, anyone coming to Toronto in January should be able to get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Found a Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Jeff B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pantages Hotel for 2 nights with friends and had an amazing time! It was a unit inside of the Hotel, but privately owned!! Who knew? I ended up paying a fraction of what they rent it for on their sites. I went to www.flipkey.com/toronto-condo-rentals/p262447/ from a link I found on TripAdvisor. Saved a ton, and it had everything including a kitchen, washer/dryer, dishwasher - the mix. Will definitely rent again!

Reviews.Title: “Hip and Chic”
Reviews.Author: TravellerFeet
Reviews.Content: Located at the heart of Toronto right next to Eaton Center. Everything is almost from walking distance and 10-15 minute walk from the ACC. When we first got there the hotel is very chic for the upscale for young couples and the business class. The receptionist were nice and our room was fabulous. Very romantic and the interior design was modern. The washrooms were clean and the room was very spacious. The only problem is the parking was very confusing and you have to pay additional everything. Like the parking, the wifi and the food is very expensive for what they give you is somewhat small and mediocre. Your basically paying the presentation of the food. Overall the place was great.

Reviews.Title: “What a New Years Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Slushee
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe my experience here. I had to actually write to the general manager as his staff were incompetent, insulting and extremely condescending. Here's a story for you: I booked a boutique suite through Travel Sensations valued at $309.00 for 4 guests. I have documentation for this reservation. Upon arrival, I was asked to sign some waivers and was informed that my reservation was correct for the amount and for 4 guests. The woman pointed out that any additional guest(s) will have an extra charge of $50/person. I explained to her that my reservations include the 4 guests so there should not be any additional costs. She clarified it for the second time that the reservation was for 4 guests. Next morning, at the time of checkout I spoke to a gentleman named Ibrahim who surprised me with an amount of $409.00 for the rate of the room. He told me that I was being charged for the extra 2 guests. Astonished, I questioned this charge and all he said was, â€œYou signed the papersâ€�. Even after presenting my reservation documents from Travel Sensations he continued to say that I had signed the papers without providing any explanation. At this point, I asked to speak to the manager. Ibrahim notified me that â€œTomâ€� was manager on duty but was unavailable as he stepped out. Furthermore to my disappointment, he was unable to tell me when Tom will be back to assist me. I asked Ibrahim to contact me when Tom immediately comes back as I am not authorizing this payment until it is settled in fairness. While waiting for Tom's call, I decided to go back after two hours. To my surprise he was back at reception. After explaining the whole matter to him including the provided documents from Travel Sensations, all he told me was â€œIs this your Signature?â€� â€œWell, you signed the papers,â€� and â€œHow much more clarification do you need?â€� I not only felt baffled but also belittled as his tone and language was extremely condescending and inappropriate towards any client for that matter. In addition, he stated â€œPersonally, if it was me I would have read the papers more thoroughlyâ€�. After feeling insulted, I asked for his managerâ€™s number and was presented with the General Manager's contact. After three days I finally got in contact with the General Manager (Mark) who reviewed the case. All he replied to me was "I have enclosed the adjustment to your credit card and apologize for not making this correction during your check in." I am still extremely disappointed with Pantages Hotel as it's not the $100.00 I was concerned about but rather the customer service. The staff here are disrespectful, condescending and extremely rude. Avoid this Hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A NIGHTMARE!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa F
Reviews.Content: I pre-paid for two nights through an internet site, showed the confirmation email upon check in. Gave a credit card for incidentals when upon check out, the card was billed again! My stay consisted of a Friday-Sunday stay. I was charged as a "no show" on Saturday night! How is that possible? I am working to get $500 of the $800 back from this hotel! My bank can't do anything. I am in the states fighting to get my money back! I am extremely unhappy with this experience. The room was not what I expected either. Not to mention this was my birthday trip. An unhappy birthday it was.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Kate2263
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent one night stay last week at Pantages. The location is perfect, easy to get to, parking is available at a public garage directly across the street or valet at the hotel itself. We were in town for a concert at Massey Hall, which is across the street as well. Eaton Center is one short block away - ideal! Check in was quick and easy with the very friendly Ibrahim. He was thorough in explaining the hours and events happening at the hotel that evening. I requested a room on a higher floor, and we got an Urban Suite on the 13th floor. The room was fantastic! Very spacious, clean, loved the kitchen area in the room. Excellent views of the city. All staff that we encountered were extremely friendly, welcoming, and thanked us for staying with them. Ricky, the valet, was always welcoming when we returned to the hotel. Overall, a great experience, and we will absolutely stay here whenever we are in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, ROOM AND GABRILLA!”
Reviews.Author: RoRe
Reviews.Content: We have been there for 5 nights and it was a good experience. The room was good sized and modern and spotless. The reception staff are fluctuating, generally male staff are nicer than female ones, even their English is better. The breakfast was a disaster, nothing worth to get up early for it, the only great thing about it was meeting Gabrilla the waitress which was really nice to all of the guest and very welcoming, she was even trying to teach my wife some English every day :) The location is the best thing about it, 3 minutes walking to Dundas square where you get to everywhere. overall positive experience

Reviews.Title: “Pantages is Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Ami0715
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Toronto and was here on business. Some of my friends recommended I stay downtown to take in the city. I am so glad I did. The rooms were amazing, spacious, clean and cozy. Lots of nice room to work and move around in. The staff was welcoming and went above and beyond to ensure I had everything I needed(extra thank you to Ryan) to make my stay comfortable. I am not one for typical chain hotels if I can help it and this was definitely a nice change. It is close to shopping and events. I would highly recommend it if you are there on business or vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend!”
Reviews.Author: caribbeangal6
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the beautiful Cosmopolitan (sister hotel) and was therefore expecting the same qualtiy--WRONG! It should not be classified as a boutique hotel..I have stayed at nicer hostels in Scotland for way less! I requested a non-smoking and got a smoking room..can't believe they still exsist..the air quality must be extremely poor in this hotel as the room just reaked! I woke at 4 am feeling like I had been in a smokey dance club all night..my lungs hurt! As well, the sofa has burn holes in it...I was really not impressed.. second and third hand smoke..what a health hazard..this hotel should be shut down by Public Health until its air quality improves. The hotel is also dreary and dark...painted the darkest, dingiest colours...so not cozy. I would not stay here again...very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “great location- nice decor and some rooms”
Reviews.Author: Namaste24
Reviews.Content: it was my first time at this hotel that i had never heard about before and i was very impressed when i walked in. I was given a super beautiful room on the 4th floor and everything was perfect. The bathroom has a great glass shower plus a jacuzzi. The only problem is that it can get noisy cuz of the trucks outside and a certain noise that comes from the room above- they told me it was the pipes. The next night i moved to another room much higher and no noise but the room could not compare. Just a bath/shower and there was an old tv. I dont watch tv but it was a suite and compared to my earlier room that had a flat screen. When i switched room i was asked if i wanted a wake up call which i did for an important meeting the next but unforutanley i never got my wake up call- As i left the hotel i mentioned it to the desk clerk and was told that he was about to call me. It was too late and i was late. I wrote this all in the comment card but never got a reply. Im not one to complain but you pay 175$ a night.... one block away from Eaton center and main areas of downtown Toronto and not far from the Island airport. Friendly staff,

Reviews.Title: “3 star at best”
Reviews.Author: Ross C
Reviews.Content: We bought a Groupon coupon for $199 which included valet parking ($35), internet ($12 - who charges for internet anymore?!), 2 martini's ($25) and 2 continental breakfasts (don't know what they would have charged but wouldn't be worth the price). For any hotel in downtown TO that is a very good value. The problem was the actual hotel itself. Promoted as a boutique, it's more a boutique wannabe. Dark and dingy would be closer. The front staff David Lui was a little to quick with the "rules". I watched him argue with a customer about her credit card, saying it wasn't hers... finally he admitted it was. He was very quick tempered. In my case though, he was courteous. The whole place looks like it has been painted over, with buckets of paint. Worse was our room. I called a week before arriving to request a 2 bedroom room, which was confirmed. We arrived to one queen size bed, and worse - a smoking room! Didn't know they still had those. It smelled of smoke but we were tired and went with it anyway. The top bed sheet had a burn hole right in the middle of it... very romantic. There was a full size fridge and stove - although the fridge was pretty much full with overpriced booze. No full strength coffee, just decaf. We asked for and received the good stuff. Location is excellent, no complaints there. Eat a Frans around the corner, good comfort food. We wouldn't stay there again, just too dark and dingy. I grew up in Toronto and have stayed at pretty much every hotel there. Have to say the King Edward is a favourite.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Lyge
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pantages for a conference I was attending in Toronto. I arrived long before checkin and had to get to the conference. Not wanting to cart my bag to the conference I went to the Pantages first. There I was greeted by a very friendly staff member who stored by bag which allowed me to get to where I had to go. Checkin was super smooth and again the staff was very friendly. The room was nice, very clean and a decent size. Because the Pantages is a suite hotel it had a fridge (decent size), stove, 4 burner cook top, and get this...a dishwasher! Internet service cost an additional $12.00 but it was fast and reliable. You can't say enough about the location. Right downtown in the middle of everything, Massey Hall, Royal Wintergarden Theatre (I think that's what it's called), the Eatons Centre...you name it. For breakfast be sure to check out the Senator just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “I want to rate Pantages higher but....”
Reviews.Author: alliebaz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 night stay at Pantages. We have stayed at the Cosmopolitan on several occasions and had always wanted to try Pantages, their sister hotel in Toronto. I loved the layout and the amenities of our room and the decor was appealing. The bed however, was not comfortable. The mattress was rock hard and the pillows were way too big - my back and neck were sore in the morning. In addition, on 2 of the 3 nights we stayed in the hotel, we were awakened by loud people in the hallway. The first night, it seemed to be a group of people who were coming back from the clubs and heading in and out of a room on our floor where someone in the group was staying. The were loud, obnoxious and inconsiderate, but whatever, at least they had a reason to be there. The next night however, it was a group of girls, with one loudmouth in particular. It seems that she thought she knew someone on our floor and wanted to use their bathroom, instead of the ones in the lobby. Since she didn't know what room this "friend" was in, she proceeded to knock on every door and call out to the guy to open the door. It was SUPER annoying! At the Cosmo, you are only able to access the elevator with your room card, which felt much safer and kept the rif-raf out. Maybe later in the evening the hotel needs to have someone montioring this situation? Anyway, the combination of the bed/pillow and the noisy corridors left us coming home exhasted from what was supposed to be a relaxing, rejuvinating weekend. We loved the lobby martini bar. The drinks and food we tried were very good and both the bartenders were great. I also thought that the door staff were wonderful - hardworking, pleasant, helpful and available. The front desk staff however needs much improvement! They were bored, unhelpful and unwelcoming to the point that I felt like I was a nuisiance to them when I tried to check-in. All in all, I really wanted to love this hotel, but it fell short for me this time.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not impressive”
Reviews.Author: Goingplaces11
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at this hotel and it was okay. Our room was nothing really special. The most impressive part was the lobby. Of course the location was great but there are many hotels in the city in great locations, Hotel St. Germain for instance.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Lisa P
Reviews.Content: This was a very different experience than staying in some of the larger chain hotels. Although they can be luxurious and well-maintained, this took that idea to a whole new level. I felt like a v.i.p. the entire 3 days of my visit. The room is more like having your own personal condo in the city, designed by someone with great taste! I loved the location, I loved LOVED the martini bar, and overall the staff were very personable and we were sad to leave! I would definitely splurge on this experience again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: chantl011
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Pantages Suite Hotel and would definitely recommend it to anyone who is either looking for an extremely central location or who is considering an extended stay. In the latter case, the full kitchen suite and in-suite laundry facilities would be a great benefit. In my case, it was location that was key and certainly provided all that I needed. Despite being only one block away from both a hospital and Yonge street, I found the hotel very quiet and peaceful. The staff were pleasant and helpful. The free wi-fi was a definite benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Wowed!”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem in the city center! My wife and I enjoyed three days and two nights over our anniversary weekend and felt as though we were living in the city rather than just visiting. With a full kitchen in our suite we were able to cook for ourselves and enjoy the martini bar on the lobby level in the evenings, where a pianist played from 9:30 - 1 am. A super hotel with a super spa! Yes, we took full advantage of the spa as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but it's the last time I'll stay at the Pantages.”
Reviews.Author: marybensyd
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Pantages about 15 times over the past five years because of the quality of the accommodation, the location and the great service. Unfortunately, the condition of the rooms has been getting progressively worse and I was shocked by the state of it during my my recent stay. The furniture was shabby, the mattress on the fold-away couch was disgusting, the curtains are stained, the laminate floorboards have pulled apart in spots, and the floors and bathroom really need a good scrub. All these things are maintenance issues, not house-keeping. I wrote to the manager and did not receive a response until I completed the online survey. The manager responded and indicated that he would call me to discuss. The call never came, which was disappointing as I would have liked to have chatted with him about my experience. I won't be staying there again but if you don't mind a room that's a bit tatty and somewhat spotty service, the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Booked for 4 nights, left in one :-(”
Reviews.Author: wiljor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to try something different then the name brand hotels so we looked on the internet and saw the. Great web page but not what you see when you arrive. The room was like having a bed in a kitchen. Cooking facilities, fridge stove, and a bed. Looked like the designer wanted to see what a bed in a kitchen would be like as that's the impression we got. The room smelled old and dusty and I could not get that sent out of my throat and nose. There are no services like a hotel would have, room service etc.. We ordered up coffee and they brought us packages and told us to make it ourselves. There is a Restaraunt down stairs and we tried to get something when we arrived but forget it as it was closed, at 10pm and when we asked they said "it was not busy, so we close" Any how, we checked out the next day, by by and no recommendation from me here

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - We strongly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Blitzpacker
Reviews.Content: Friendly hotel in the Theatre district. Great central location within walking distance to many attractions! Definite must for those coming from another country to visit Toronto! Martini Bar is a lot of fun. The on premises diner is open 24 hours! Great for a late night snack.

Reviews.Title: “Deceptive billing-beware hidden fees!”
Reviews.Author: nomi203
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well maintained. Clean, in a safe neighborhood and within walking distance of key places to visit. However, I urge people to beware the hidden fees! When we first arrived, I asked about the cheapest way to call the US. I was told I could purchase a phone card from the gift shop and then call from my room. The call would then be local and I would not be charged. I stayed there for 9 days and followed the front desk person's advice. At the end of the trip, I found out I was billed for those local calls! I explained what the person checking us in had said, but they refused to rescind the charges. In general, I think there were equally nice hotels within blocks of this one that charged less. The big lure is the spa component, but the services were extremely expensive and there were more reasonable prices to be found in the area. Plus, since this hotel is located near office buildings, only a few fast food places were open for dinner or brunch.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff working against aging facility”
Reviews.Author: brufound
Reviews.Content: The staff at Pantages was uniformly pleasant and accommodating; the location was perfect for theatre and a fabulous dinner within walking distance; the bed was comfortable; the price was a good deal; the martini bar had a good vibe. But, the facility is badly in need of work. Chipped paint, black duct tape between the carpet and wood-look floor and a shower that drained so slowly that 3" accumulated made the experience less than we had hoped.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, service could be better”
Reviews.Author: msatrip
Reviews.Content: Positives: Location, martini bar and servers, very comfortable and clean bed (didn't want to get out of bed in the morning), rain shower, some staff very friendly and helpful, good space in one bedroom suite, very quick check-in and check-out process, room had many windows and good natural light Negatives: Food options, door staff not always helpful (I had to go in and ask for someone to help me bring in my luggage when I arrived, and had to wait quite a while for someone to help me with my luggage when I was checking out), safe not in room (it is in a storage room, very inconvenient), expensive internet and strange charge schedule (i.e. if you order your internet to be activated at 8pm, you are charged one full day but do not get it for 24 hours. Rather, it resets at noon the next day), no parking (even drop off area very small), dim lighting in rooms, furniture a bit dated and could use a paint job

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Plus!”
Reviews.Author: trishsargeant
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were meeting in Toronto en route to New York City. Our experience with the Pantages Hotel was so wonderful, we wished we had another day in Toronto. The excellent experience started with a friendly front desk person who asked if we would mind being upgraded (free) as they had a suite available!! Who would not want to be upgraded? We were given a beautiful one bedroom suite complete wth five appliances. We truly enjoyed the luxury. Everything was top notch....the staff, towels and bedding, cleanliness, furniture, hardwood floors. The location was excellent and the price was reasonable. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Too pricey for what you get”
Reviews.Author: lacybass
Reviews.Content: I chose Pantages based on the great website pictures, location, our preference for a modern hotel. Although our stay was enjoyable, I think the hotel is too pricey and the pictures on the website look better that what you get. Pros-good location, close to Dundas subway and Eaton Centre, we were in a chic suite (cheapest room) which still includes a small kitchen and washer/dryer, rooms do appear to be fairly new/updated and were clean Cons-I think I could have gotten a better price at similar hotels downtown, parking is expensive (we chose the hospital deck across the street which is cheaper on weekends). We spent around $65 for Friday night-Monday morning in the hospital deck vs. over $90 at the hotel's parking. Hotel put a hold of $300 extra dollars on my credit card for 5 business days plus my room charge which is a bit excessive. Many extra charges-charge for internet, small box of washing detergent, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Pareili
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Toronto at the Pantages for a spa day & shopping with a friend and it was perfect! Clean modern hotel in a great location. The Eatpn Center was out the door and around the corner - about a minute to get there! Got a standard room that even came with a kitchenette! The only thing that would have made it better was if we didn't have to share a Queen sized bed - but they said they were out of King sized and 2 Queens wasn't an option...otherwise a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: aerya
Reviews.Content: After researching hotels in downtown Toronto for our honeymoon, we settled on Patanges because it looked modern, has a great location and had good prices. From previous reviews, it also looked like the hotel was doing extra little things for people celebrating anniversaries, etc, so we thought we may get a little something extra for being on our honeymoon. When checking in, I mentioned that it was our honeymoon, and all the front desk guy said "well, you get a king bed", which actually comes with the chic suite... so nothing extra, which was disapointing. Then after our first day, trying to take a shower was difficult, as we had to wait over 5 minutes for the hot water to show up (the same for the next 2 morning and evenings). Also, we woke up with stiff necks and hurting backs from the too big pillows and hard mattresses. We weren't looking forward to our second night. Our second day in Toronto we were going to Wonderland, so we asked for easy, quick directions, which the front desk guy printed off Google Maps (I thought he'd pick the best route) and we ended up taking little side streets in traffic and it took us over an hour to get there... Needless to say we found a different quicker route to get back in the evening. Note that only valet parking is available, at over $30 a day, and they charge extravagant prices for mini-bar things, like $5 for 4 cookies... Take advantage of Fran's diner next door, yummy food and friendly service! Overall impression? Will not go again, and will keep looking for a comfortable affordable downtown hotel for the next time we go to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay, lots of problems”
Reviews.Author: HM_from_NH
Reviews.Content: This is an OK hotel, but if you are looking for or anticipating a luxury hotel, you'll be very disappointed. Before arriving in Toronto, we stayed at a La Quinta Inn, and found that the accommodations were nicer at La Quinta than at the Pantages. This hotel is nowhere near the caliber of the high end chains such the Four Seasons or even more moderate luxury hotels such as Hyatt, Marriott, Hilton, etc., We went with another family, and saw a total of 5 of the hotel's rooms, and none of them was great. The hotel is billed as a trendy boutique hotel, and although the decor is modern, much of the hotel was in so-so condition, with badly dented and chipped furniture, frayed sofas, and somewhat dingy hallways. Much of the hotel badly needs repainting. On the 4th floor, the door to the service elevator was kept open and exposed a filthy work area -- hardly what you want to see on the way to your hotel room. The fitness center had no amenities such as towels, nor was it air conditioned on a hot summer day. We also encountered a number of problems in the rooms: air conditioning that did not work; one room with only luke warm hot water. Unless you are a really sound sleeper, noise is another problem: the hotel is located across the street from a large hospital, and there were loud ambulance sirens through the wee hours of the morning. There is also a helipad on the rooftop, and the helicopters fly incredibly close to the hotel, making deafening noise. We also were awakened at 6:15 a.m. one morning when the garbage men decided to empty the large trash dumpsters directly below our window -- it sounded like our room was under attack. There is no concierge at the hotel, and although the staff at the front desk were pleasant, they were able to give only limited information about restaurants and events, and we found that much of the information was inaccurate. To summarize: Pros: Good location. Suites are fairly large; hotel staff were pleasant. Cons: Much of the hotel has a worn and tattered feel. There is a lot of noise at night related to the nearby hospital. No concierge. We encountered a number of problems (e.g. A/C)

Reviews.Title: “Well equipped hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Coddfish
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a heatwave in June. The hotel is conveniently located just off Yonge St and close to some of the theatres. Our room has 2 small-ish double beds, a kitchen area with a combi-oven, hob, fridge, coffee maker, kettle, washer and dryer, plus a decent bathroom with shower over the bath. The aircon was effective but noisy. Bed linen was reasonable with a feather quilt but overly bulky foam pillows. There was some crockery and a dish which could be used in the combo, but no pan for the hob. Bathroom washbasin was missing a plug. There was wifi in the room at a charge, but free wifi in the bar. There was a simple buffet breakfast in the bar downstairs, comprising juice, fruit, yogurt, bread and pastries. The bar did good cocktails in the evening plus a limited range of meals and snacks. The hotel was having some difficulties with the lift system during our stay, with rarely more than 1 out of 2 working, and on one occasion we had to use the service lift. Also no safe in the room. We liked this hotel but some of these jiggles should be fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Staff needs to go for a course in hospitality”
Reviews.Author: deedzMontreal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located; easy access to everything. However, the staff is the worst ever. My family is in the hospitality business and I have never seen a hotel with such bad staff. The only one who was the most pleasant and extremely helpful at all times is "Ricky" the valet. I stayed at the Pantages for 3 months on business in one of the suites and I never got any help from the front desk. EVER. At first I thought maybe it was me, but no. On several occasions I was in the lobby waiting for my ride and I witnessed the people at the front desk being very rude to the guests. Because they were so rude, I never ordered room service, I never went to their martini bar; etc..... ALSO - I went to the spa on Saturday for an "express" manicure and they charged me $36. That is a RIP OFF. Also, I took the time to read some of the reviews today and I noticed that the management only replied to the people who had positive comments about this hotel. I guess that says it all. Very sad, I will NEVER go back and I'll make sure our corporate meetings are not held at the Pantages.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: LeafsFan66
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked the Exotic Retreat package for our 13th anniversary last weekend. We arrived just before 1pm and our room was ready about 15 minutes later, well ahead of the posted 3pm check-in time. The room was clean and in excellent condition and very quiet. We enjoyed martinis in the martini bar and the bartender also gave us complimentary glasses of champagne and the management sent chocolate covered strawberries to our room when they learned it was our anniversary.The spa treatment was great as was the rainforest room

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SamD_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five days last week to attend a conference held at the venue. Comfortable clean rooms, helpful and friendly staff. Only issue for me was my door lock was malfunctioning most of the time. The hotel is right next to all the important places in Toronto. Excellent service and would recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: IanClark070
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of spending a weekend at the Pantages Hotel in Toronto. I recommend everyone consider this hotel when planning a trip to Toronto. The location is hard to beat, across the street from Massey Hall & one block away from Yonge Street & the Eaton Centre. Location aside, the rooms are fabulous & the staff go out of their way to ensure you are comfortable & your needs are taken care of. Not to mention the fabulous martini bar!! The Pantages remains my choice-hotel in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Kind Caring Staff in a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smithx2_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights as my husband was having day surgery on his right eye at St. Michael's Hospital. The kind caring staff, especially the doorman and the women at the front desk made us feel welcome. When special equipment had to be delivered to our room a staff member at the back in charge of deliveries came up to help us. Tshis is the place to stay in any situation.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences I've every had”
Reviews.Author: JeniseFryatt
Reviews.Content: My husband found out about the Pantages online. He was looking for a nice place in the middle of Toronto that wasn't too expensive. He received MANY kudos once we arrived. The decor is very hip (reminded me of some places in L.A.) with a Martini Bar in the lobby. For being in the heart of the city, it was remarkably quiet. The rooms were AMAZING. Attractive modern decor complete with kitchenette (even a dishwasher) AND a clothes washer and dryer. We stayed in a suite for the first 3 nights. It was spacious and gave us a nice living area where we could entertain friends. They had me at the nice decor/kitchenette. Then I found out about the yoga mats in every room. THANK YOU! And then I discovered the washer & dryer. To top it off, the building houses an excellent, classic diner - Frans. We ate there for most of our meals and it was consistently very good. I can't say enough about this place!

Reviews.Title: “BIGGEST SCAM EVER”
Reviews.Author: fletchkirsty
Reviews.Content: We were offered a rate of 105.00 through Hotelguides.com, I called the hotel a week prior to our visit to confirm the reservations and they asked If we were a travel agent, we werenâ€™t so he said that we could NOT have this special rate but could at a cost of 260.00 no where in the booking process did it say that you MUST be a travel agent to get this promotion. Blessing in disguise by the look of all the other terrible reviews given. DO NOT BOOK THROUGH THIS WEBSITE.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, trendy hotel but needs some better details.”
Reviews.Author: jssurleplateau
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in this hotel to do some sightseeing, eating and shopping in TO. Fantastic location!!! The rooms are a little on the in and trendy side, the sheets and bedding are seriously not up to the quality of the rest and the shower is horrible. For the rest, I would still recommend staying here. I would recommend to the owners of the hotel to think higher end and change the bedding (for cotton not shiny polyester) and change those terrible shower heads!!!!! The rest is fine for the price (good prices).

Reviews.Title: “nicely surprised”
Reviews.Author: clueless99
Reviews.Content: I'm usually one of those people who is somewhat disappointed when we go somewhere ...so I was pleasantly surprised!Concert at Massey Hall...which is right across the street...so extremely convenient as we're not really familiar with the streets in Toronto. We had booked dinner reservations at a restaurant , but our timing was off as my husband spent too much time at "Tom's Place" getting a great deal on some sports jackets!! We ended up coming back to the hotel and their martini bar ..had some great drinks and veggie pizza and roast beef ciabetta reasonabley priced and very good! Not fine dining but very cosy and romantic, and 6:00 was too early for a big dinner anyway.This was much less stressful not having to worry about getting a cab etc.and being on time. Our room was very modern, dark woods and subdued lighting, and kitchen set-up (although we didn't know this). My only complaint was the cold breakfast in the martini bar next morning was $15.00/each so we opted for something a little more appetizing elswhere.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Ultra Modern”
Reviews.Author: gerryinTO
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at this place last summer. My wife and I found an amazing deal (otherwise this place is pretty pricy) so we decided to take in a show and stay at nice place DT. The lounge has the BEST martinis and the rooms are extremely comfortable and well air conditioned. I was hoping for a gym or fitness centre, but oh well. Overall this is a great place and I would highly recommend it if you are visiting TO. Victoria street is somewhat secluded but still really close to all the sights and attractions. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Niche hotel”
Reviews.Author: brendonlord
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, great location, walking distance to the CBD, also busy part of town so there are plenty of cabs. Rooms are fantastic, we stayed in a unit with a separate bedroom/bathroom, very new and clean. Gym is fantastic, however you are not able to use the spa/whirlpool without paying a fee of $15 everytime, which is a rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean rooms and perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: turkeyshore
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pantages for 2 nights for a work conference Thursday/Friday night. The location was perfect, walking distance to the Eatons Centre and Yonge/Dundas Square. The rooms were nice, modern and clean. Hardwood flooring throughout. Room was facing Massey Hall entrance. Quite Noisey at night after a concert finished. Bands packing up until 3 or 4 am with large trucks and equipment. Had some problems with hot water in the shower but we just had to run the water for like 10-15 mins before the hot water worked. Hotel staff was called and someone came up right away to help but they were unable to fix it. he jsut told us to run the water. Nice stay but if I had to pay for the hotel myself I don't think I would have felt it to be valuable and worth the money. Quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern and clean”
Reviews.Author: mb1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in November and found the Pantages to be very clean, modern and conviniently located. The valet parking and check in is quick and efficient. Some of the flooring in our room was damaged, but did not negatively impact our stay. If your eyesight is poor be advised the lobby and hallways are very dark. If you are going for a show at the canon or massey hall (or really like frans diner) this is a great option to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience”
Reviews.Author: yourpookie
Reviews.Content: The service here was terrible, especially the manager of the "in house department" who gave me the run around for 2 days on our booking before finally saying the room was unavailable unless we paid an exhorbitant rate. He screamed of attitude and was so terrible he should be fired.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Tdot_to_Van0924
Reviews.Content: A nice, chic, very MODERN hotel in the heart of downtown- Yonge and Dundas, steps away from the Eaton Centre. Its pretty small, I'm used to walking into large lobbys and this one struck me as pretty tight. The hotel bar/lounge was very busy and happening on a Saturday night and seemed like a hot spot. The rooms were nice, I noticed some of the art on the walls (mounted on wood-not framed) were tearing at the corners, which I thought looked a bit cheap.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choic”
Reviews.Author: tobeginwith
Reviews.Content: The Pantages in conveniently located in downtown Toronto. It's hip but not snotty, and clean and comfortable, making it a top choice. Most (maybe all?) rooms have a washer/dryer unit and a full kitchen, which makes one's stay even more comfortable. There's a nice martini bar in the lobby and Fran's, a 24 hour diner is next door. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay to visit Massey Hall”
Reviews.Author: PCBailey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night while we were in town to see Billy Connolly at Massey Hall. It is a great location for Massey Hall, the Canon Theater and the Eatons Centre. There are many good restaurants in the area. Our deluxe queen suite was a corner room on the 15th floor. It was a good size and came with a kitchen which is very convenient for cold drinks, but the fridge is noisy when trying to sleep. The queen bed was comfortable and there were lots of pillows. We had a rate of $175 plus 16% tax. We thought parking was a bit expensive at $32 plus tax ($4) plus tip ($10), though they did allow us to stay parked after check out so we could do some shopping. They also stored our luggage for a few hours. Staff was very helpful and friendly. There is no pool and the lobby is quite small. I would stay here again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent classy hotel, big rooms, good service, good food”
Reviews.Author: Jillinthebox
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel very central in Toronto. The service is good and the downstairs bar area is nice and classy, easy to meet friends there and stay for drinks instead of heading out into town like you might do in lots of other hotel bars - this one stands alone as a good bar. The rooms are big and spacious, the bathrooms a comfortable size with separate bath and shower. Big wardrobes and all the usual modcons, with some unusual extras in the minibar like jellybeans and condoms!!! Super comfy beds, and the room service here is really good. Excellent tasty food and quick service. The gym is your typical hotel gym, all the usual machines to use. In your room you also get a yoga mat, and there's a channel on the TV with a yoga DVD you can do anytime, which is pretty cool. I've stayed here 2 years in a row, and wouldn't hestitate to stay here again, or recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful service and staff. clean rooms...”
Reviews.Author: rawkafella
Reviews.Content: wonderful service and staff. clean rooms. beautiful venue.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great amenities”
Reviews.Author: pebblezs
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Pantage during Labor Day weekend. The hotel is half a block from The Eaton Centre, transportation and nearby chinatown. We were able to book the double queen bed room which we were informed there was only two in the entire hotel. Great amenities, we had a kitchenette, microwave, sink, full working stove and oven and a refrigerator. The TV could've been updated to a flat screen. There was a washer and dryer in the room which we took full advantage of. My friend and I ventured out to chinatown, its walkable and about 20-25 minute walk which is a great exercise. The only upset was we waited about 90 minutes plus for our room to be ready and there was one night where a bunch of college kids were throwing a party in one of the rooms right across the hall from us, when I say right across the hall it was about 2 feet from the door to our room. Other than that this was definitely great stay and will return the next time I visit Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Adventure”
Reviews.Author: intheairtravel
Reviews.Content: hilarious hotel ! we laughed for the whole stay , we finally arrive to main door and wait for someone to help us with luggage but no luck ! I went to the reception and the agent tells me that someone will help us soon , you'd think any of them will offer but no ! anyway after we check in ( miracle ! ) we get in the room and it all starts LOL I heard this sound and i wasn't sure if its the wine or the long trip , that was the washer in the room washing the towels ! anyway no big deal at least they wash towels infront of you! all they want you to do is dry them . we had a PR event for TIFF , requested a wake up call and never got it ! while getting ready i tried the ipod dock apparently its just there for decoration. wanted to snack something I called down the first time no answer , second time i was told I have to wait till they open or check out the minibar LOL so decided to rush out and leave to the event and my heels got stuck in between the laminated wooden floors because its not installed properly ! its my fault for rushing out with heels but i didnt see this one coming , ( no i didnt fall , haha) but that was the cherry on top , at least for my friend shes still going around telling the story . to be honest its not that bad , good location , good beds and pillows but other than that the place is not happening and the staff look miserable so think twice if you are demanding. i would recommend the hotel for a bachelorette party or something like that....

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service”
Reviews.Author: LJM04
Reviews.Content: This is a warning to anyone who is thinking of booking an event or plans to stay at the Pantages Hotel or Cosmopolitan Hotel....DON'T! I tried to book one of their event rooms for a bridal shower and twice I was told that there was a rooms available only for them to come back within the next few days to tell me that they were already booked. I asked how could they continuously double book people in the same room and they could not provide an answer a good answer. I ended up using a room that was not my first choice but there wasn't much I could do since invitations had already been mailed. I am usually a pretty easy going person but I must say that this was the worst experience I have ever had dealing with a hotel. I would not recommend this place (or the Cosmopolitan) to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday!”
Reviews.Author: vanessm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pantages for my birthday in mid-August. We booked an Ambassador suite through their website, as we came across a sale a few weeks prior and found an amazing deal. The room was very spacious and clean. The bathroom was a fair size and had a great shower. We love the ipod dock that was provided and had a full kitchen in the main room. And the bed - it was amazing! I wish we could have laid in it all day! That being said, there were 2 flaws with our room. The separate bedroom was missing its door handle and the small hallway leading to the bathroom had 1 burnt light bulb. It did not affect our overall experience though. We loved the room! It was like an apartment. I also had the opportunity to have a massage at the spa as well and it was lovely. All in all - I would definitely stay at the Pantages again. The location was perfect - seconds to both Queen and Dundas subway stations and walking distance to great local amenities, such as Fran's which was perfect for a morning breakfast. The lobby is trendy as well. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A funky boutique hotel with a great vibe.”
Reviews.Author: Catalin22
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I headed to Pantages Suites Hotel in the heart of downtown Toronto for a one night getaway. We pulled up to the hotel, and were pleasantly greeted by the bellboy, who immediately removed our luggage from the car, and then proceeded to valet park our vehicle. As we stepped through the door, it was like we were transported to a funky lounge, surrounded by dim lighting, and a moody atmosphere. The attendant at the front desk was very friendly and efficient in checking us in. We proceeded to our room, and once again, were blown away at the size and set up of our suite! It was basically a small apartment, with a very comfortable sitting area, a clean and spacious bathroom, quite a large kitchen with a stocked fridge, snacks, plates, cutlery, glasses, an automatic dishwasher..wow! The view from the sitting area was lovely, with floor to ceiling windows. The separate bedroom was also very spacious, with huge closet space. The bed, I have to say, had the most luxurious linens I have ever come across in a hotel -anywhere! There was even a washing machine and dryer! Seriously, you could live in a space like this! I highly recommend the Pantages Hotel in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Sure it's run down, but ...”
Reviews.Author: Tyler_R
Reviews.Content: I ended up booking the Pantages hotel for my stay over the weekend in Toronto with a friend. I was worried about the reviews I read saying the hotel was run down. Well, the reviews were right. It's clear that the hotel has fallen into disrepair and is a shadow of its former self, but it's not that big of a deal. The room is large and was still in good condition, the staff is really nice (they had my room ready for check-in at 8:00 AM!), the location is excellent, and I got a really good deal on hotels.com. Sure the air conditioning sucks, the buttons on the elevator don't light up, the chairs in the martini bar are falling apart, and if you lean against the water feature built-into the wall next to the elevator it actually falls back into the wall (!?) ... but the plusses really outweigh the minuses in this case. I'll stay here again when I'm in Toronto, and maybe the management will even read my review and spend some money on upkeep. :-)

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A DUMP AND DON'T EXPECT ANY SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: travelerjrm
Reviews.Content: Booked a trip to Toronto on travelocity.com under their TOP SECRET hotel program. They indicated it was 4 star hotel-- what a joke-- more like a 2.5 star with 1.5 star service. No hot water the first day-- took a cold shower -- asked to be moved they said no. Hotel staff rude and unaccommodating. Sorry bed linens. DONT STAY THERE and be careful about using tracelocity.com Top secret hotel program -- what a rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Pleasures”
Reviews.Author: mmkshopaholic
Reviews.Content: A very "big city" hotel with all the perks that go along with that. The hotel is beautiful and modern. The employees were courteous and the pastries in the morning were tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and chic”
Reviews.Author: danicaaa
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE Pantages. I book a suite for my birthday every year. Their valet parkers are super friendly, as well as their front desk and bellhop. The location is at Yonge & Dundas which is close to everything downtown toronto's nightlight has to offer. It is conveniently right beside Fran's 24-hour breakfast joint which is awesome for when you come back to your room after a night on the town. The decor is simply beautiful. The furniture is very modern - it's a place I wish I lived in. I booked an executive suite which has a separate bedroom and living room/kitchenette area. The bedroom also has a washer/dryer for extended stays. The kitchenette comes with a fully functioning stove, microwave, regular sized fridge, and sink. Unfortunately, no oven. Both the living area and the bedroom have TVs and free wireless. It's a pricier stay, but well worth a treat to myself and my friends once a year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: BrendaH
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure where all the poor reviews are coming from. We stayed at this hotel when it first opened and were very impressed. We booked it again for last weekend, and I was a bit concerned when I saw all the negative reviews posted here. My concerns were completely unjustified. We had a lovely two nights at the hotel. Service was excellent, from the valets to the front desk staff to the housekeeping staff - we were treated to friendly, efficient service at all times. When, after the first night, we decided we'd rather have foam than down pillows, and we needed a new battery for the TV remote, we wrote our housekeeping staff a note before we left the hotel in the morning. When we returned about an hour later, our room was clean, our pillows had been replaced, and someone from maintenance had been sent to fix our remote. We also had terrific service and a lot of fun in the martini bar on Friday night - happy hour was a great deal. If I would change anything at the hotel, it would a little thing - the lighting at the mirror in the bathroom was a bit dim. My old eyes had a hard time seeing well enough to get my make-up on straight. We were in room 1601 which had very cool views from two different sides. It had an entrance hallway, and then another hallway leading to the main part of the room. It had no kitchen facilities, but, strangely, had a washer and dryer. I can't imagine someone needing laundry facilities that wouldn't also benefit from a kitchen; however, we didn't require any of it, so it wasn't an issue for us. The room had an iPod doc, which was a nice touch. A couple of times, we heard helicopters landing on the roof of the hospital next door, but we found it more interesting than annoying. Yes, the decor and lighting in the public areas of the hotel is funky and unusual, but we like it - it's nice to experience something different than the same old generic hotel ambiance. We're 50-ish, and enjoy the youthful staff, clientele and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Go to the bar, but don't stay in the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vanvcouverguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel tries to be like a W hotel but fails. I checked in and proceed to my room and it was 28 degrees C. The staff had turned off the air conditioning and the room was unbearably hot. I called down to reception and was told the room would cool quickly, so I went out to dinner. 2 hrs later the room was 26 degrees. The maintenance guy gave me a truthful answer: "they put in the cheapest HVAC system possible". Overall the room finishing are very cheap: laminate flooring, basic bed and linens, cheap fixtures in the bathroom. Don't be tricked into thinking this is a boutique hotel. The staff weren't helpful, the attention to detail is poor, the room quality is low....the only thing that resembles a boutique hotel is the reception / bar area and the pictures they put on the website

Reviews.Title: “My sisters were thrilled”
Reviews.Author: djlottoe
Reviews.Content: I was in charge of booking a hotel for my three sisters and myself for the One of a Kind Show. I visit and stay in hotels in Toronto at least four times a year so am familiar with a lot of them. I had never been to the Pantages so decided to check it out. They had a Special on in April which was great so I booked 2 rooms which we couldn't get on the same floor for some unexplained reason as they didn't seem that busy.....it was mid-week. Anyway, we were only one floor apart at the top of the hotel with great city views. The rooms are large, nicely furnished, each had 2 queen beds separated by a partial wall which was nice, a full kitchen and laundry facilities (which we didn't need, but nice touch). The staff were very pleasant and helpful. We ordered room service one night and the food was great and not overpriced for Toronto. We did have two problems....(1) our maid service forgot to clean our room...we had been out until 3:30 one day and upon return our room was not done. Then we heard the maid outside our door so were waiting for her to knock so we could let her in and leave.....we had the sign on the door. Well, she left the floor after cleaning all the other rooms so we had to call and have her come up to do ours. The second problem involved a gift basket my husband had sent to us from a local florist that the hotel did receive but because my last name was missing one letter they didn't put 2 and 2 together to realize it was for us. Instead of calling the florist to ask about it or send it back they put it in the hotel fridge and there it sat until I returned home 2 days later. My husband asked how we enjoyed the fruit basket and you can imagine the rest. As our kids would say...."a major lunch bag let-down". As luck would have it we have a daughter who lives in Toronto so we had them deliver it to her.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a Hotel... Needs severe improvement in Standards!”
Reviews.Author: DOVCLICK
Reviews.Content: Our nightmare began at check-in. Though we had booked the package two weeks earlier, our room was not ready when we arrived. The lifestyle personal as they are called were at a loss as to how to deal with the situation. When we were given our room after a wait of 45 minutes in a narrow lobby area, the package I had booked was not there. Two hours latter a housemaid comes in with the champagne, amenities and to sprinkle the flower petals while my wife watched.... they throughly screwed up my plans. The spa part of the package was really bad... the staff stood around and giggled and talked amoung themselves and there was a lack of concentration to our service. The room itself was dingy, old scratched furniture, the door had to be pushed to be closed, linen not to standard as they advertise on their sites, bad cleanliness..... was just not worth the money i paid to them. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. Just not worth it. They need to improve big time!

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Funky but.......”
Reviews.Author: sandytoez
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I went to a concert at Massey Hall and stayed here which is right around the corner. Great location in downtown Toronto!! Upon entering the lobby there was this really funky groovy feel to it and we liked it immediately. Check in was amazingly quick and the staff are very courteous and friendly. We were given a key to the mini bar which we did not touch as I have fallen into that trap before. The elevator will not move if you don't have your key card to swipe which is a nice feature however, it took a few seconds to figure this out. Our room was on the eleventh floor so we had a nice view of the city. It was a huge room with a king bed and windows that you could open. Smallish bathroom with basic amenities but nice soft towels. And the bed was very comfy. (We had just returned from a 5 star resort in Mexico so I am trying to be objective here) Our room had a FULL kitchen. There were a lot of goodies piled on the shelf in our room and I don't know if I reserved a room with all of this but that is what we got. Even a washer and dryer!! Didn't want it and probably paid for it. There was construction going on outside the building with workers hammering, trucks backing and beeping, etc. We were way above the construction but could hear it very well. I just put in my earplugs and closed the window. I mentioned it to the desk clerk in the morning when we were checking out and he was apologetic and stated that he did not know that they worked on a Saturday and that we could have been given another room if we had requested. There is this nice little Martini Bar in the lobby and we tried to get a seat but it was full to capacity. This was just a quick little visit and we liked the hotel. We would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: MByrnes99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, March 6 & 7. In our room there was no hot water, the toilet seat would not stay in the up position, there was only one coffee mug, one set of towels and there were no electrical outlets near the desk. All there was was an overstuffed extension cord. To plug in my computer, I had to push the heavy TV dresser away from the wall to get access to the electrical outlet behind it. We complained and got a free upgrade for the second night, but that room was not ready until 6:00 p.m. on the second day. This hotel was not dirty, per se, but it wasn't the cleanest and certainly not what I was expecting for the money. A far better choice would have been to stay at Le Germain, which is another boutique hotel in the same class. Although not as centrally located, it is still "downtown" and that it where I will be going next time. It is much cleaner and friendlier and very well maintained - unlike Pantages. We have stayed at Pantages before and it was better. But it has very much deteriorated quality-wise since my first stay a couple of years ago. We will not return.

Reviews.Title: “cupid in the city”
Reviews.Author: vjay82
Reviews.Content: This hotel surprised me , when I did booking for valentines to surprise my girlfriend I didn't go with the romantic package that they had on the website because I couldn't afford it and later on the way to the hotel I started regretting that. fortunately i didn't have to because she was so happy and impressed , we arrived to the hotel and it was so busy and kinda glamourous as my girlfriend put it, we walked in and there was red rose petals all the way to front desk with roses and candles that was romantic enough. I was immediately relived and didn't feel bad for not going with the package , although we had to wait for our room but that made total sense since the place was booming with people going in and out. So we checked in the front desk by a nice lady got to the room and decided to order room service but no one answered then tried operator but same thing , figured they were really busy until I went down again and I was told that room service starts later in the evening. anyway my girlfriend was so happy and she loved the room and since the weather bad we decided to go to the spa but they couldn't take us in for anything as they were booked all day and that was another disappointment. luckily the location is amazing and we were able to walk to a nice italian restaurant by the end of the street.we came back around 7 and I was still feeling bad for not getting that package since everything in the city was fully booked but we had another surprise waiting for us .... they had small soft bag with a "LOVE" stone in it on our pillows with a chocolate dipped strawberries and a rose Â , ive been to hotels before but that is one special turn down service we got ! my girlfriend thought I had something to do with it and YES I took the credit......hahah it was a nice experience over all , i would recommend this hotel for special occasions especially if your stuck in the city and cant get somewhere different. staff is nice and cleaning crew super nice they treated us as if we were on our honeymoon. As for food or spa we didnt get a chance to try it. rooms are not luxurious as advertised but definitely spacious, well equipped and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Just a Hotel not A Spa or Resort;(2Stars)”
Reviews.Author: skydancer_2003
Reviews.Content: We checked in to this Spa Resort Hotel on 12/29/2009 11:30 pm and we were misled into believing that we would be soaking our road tired bones in a Whirlpool made for two, what a fairy tale we were told. This is a nice hotel in a prime location (2 star property) but no way is this hotel anything more, the martini bar is small about the size of a small two car garage and the diner is just that, a very busy family style diner. There is nothing fancy about this place and there are no Spa tubs or swimming pools anywhere to be found. The guest floors were dark, I mean so dark that we couldn't see the room numbers on the doors, this was scary. This hotel caters a 21 to 35 year old crowd as we went up and down on the elevator, the first time for our whirlpool suite that wasn't and then a second time for our free upgrade. We noticed a lot of young faces and my wife and I are in our 50's. Long story short we paid a $75.00 on the spot cancellation fee and drove an hour and a half to the Marriott Fallsview hotel in Niagara Falls and yes they had our 2 person whirlpool spa tub waiting in a premium suite with a bedroom view of the falls all for about $175.00 plus tax, about the same as Pantages. The staff was friendly but we were not happy when the described amenities given to us when the reservation was made were not even an option at this hotel. The shower/tub that is available is a small one-person two-jet tub not a two person oversized jacuzzi as the reservation agent said they had. After driving for more than 12 hours to get to the hotel, we were very tired and annoyed to find we were misled by the reservation agent. This hotel is a last resort choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but confused about what they were trying to achieve”
Reviews.Author: Sporty_Wales
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 3 night whistle stop tour of Toronto City. I'll start first with the hotel. Would I recommend it to friends and family? Yes definately for the right price. I booked through expedia and paid Â£89 a night. The hotel was clean and my room was confortable and spacious. I was on the 12th floor and had a room facing lively Younge Street which was a bonus. Location - Location wise, the hotel is situated behind Younge Street and a 3-4 minute walk to Eaton Mall for those wishing to shop till they drop. Therefore location wise, it was ideal. Check-In - Professional and seconds rather than minutes. Full marks. Room - The room was spacious and clean. However some of the fixtures and fittings did look a bit tired. If I am honest I was expecting the quality to be a bit better. As with most websites, the pictures interpreate a better feel and quality than there usually is. The bathroom was nothing special and can be compared to any standard hotel room. There were plenty of room for luggage and clothes therefore no problems there. The mini kitchen was excellent and I was a solo traveller and could spend a little less money on takeaways. Just be aware of the stocked food. There will be a hidden price list some where and they are not freebies! Bed - The most important thing....Again ticked the boxes as being very confomfortable. Air Con - The room had a self- control unit which worked well. Hotel Feel - The hotel is trying to be an "urban chick" ultra modern. The foyers and sitting area is small but definately modern. The corridors and lifts have purple and lime lighting, which to be honest there is no need for it. I can see what they are trying to do with the hotel, however in truth, it is another appartment style hotel in a tourist City spot. If all the fixtures felt new and cutting edge, then possibly I could see the reason, but their not. Issue - No issues really, appart that the rooms do NOT have a safety deposit box, which I would expect in a 4* property. There are ones near the reception area that were kept in a unused staff room type. I used one and had no problems, but just to make you aware. Also they advertise a 27" Flat TV. The TV I had was a standard 27" kept in a closet type. Other: Didn't try the spa therefore can't comment. Also the room service is VERY expensive and beyond realism really.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Vilix
Reviews.Content: Visited Toronto for a week and stayed in Pantages. Chose it because it was said to be a four star hotel, but it wasn't. Maybe 3+. The location of the hotel was excellent thou. Travelled with my mother and there was only one bed!! I asked a room with two separate beds but they said that all were booked. I don't think so. Anyway the room was quite good and luckily the bed was wide engouh for both of us. I don't understand the american style to have only one blanket for two. And when I asked for another, they brought this sad, thin blanket. You americans have a lot to learn about europeans with this!! Anyway I love Canada and would like to come back soon and could stay at Pantages if the prices were lower and wi-fi should be free! High technology is the thing for today and should be free inside the hotel, 12 CAD is absolutely TOO MUCH!! Did not want to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Drexs1
Reviews.Content: We found Pantages Hotel on Expedia.ca. We thought the location was great so decided to give it a change. We are glad we did. The hotel is conveniently located on block from the Eaton Centre and Younge/Dundas Square. You could not ask for a more convenient location, close to transit and within walking distance to most attractions downtown. The hotel itself it very nice. The elevators have cool lights that change colors, the hallways are nicely decorated, and the rooms are spacious, modern and clean. It was nice to have the radio playing relaxing music upon entering the room. As well, we went out to see Cirque de Soleil shortly after we arrived, and when we came back, our room had turn down service complete. A really nice touch. The room had a great kitchenette and also a washer/dryer for those who run out of clean clothes on their vacation. The staff at the front counter were extremely pleasant, courteous, and knowledgeable to conveniences located near the hotel. We will definately stay at this hotel again upon our next visit to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated for price”
Reviews.Author: crawlstroke
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Room 403 for the weekend and was quitedisappointed. Though room faces alley and building across, management might attend to keeping room in better shape. Sheets actually had holes in them. The room itself is in dire need of maintenance: Drywall tape above shower was peeling--due to a shower head that shot water directly on the ceiling. Door latch/lock did not have a metal plate and door latched in into sheet rock frame? Jet bathtub was grungy-looking. I couldn't bring myself to take a bath. Decorative pot in room was cracked and then reglued. Wouldn't you just get rid of the broken vase instead of tackily leaving it there broken but poorly fixed? Service was only so-so. On the positive side: great bed and location.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: SickinVegas1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I absolutely love Canada and decided to take a trip to Toronto to celebrate our 1st anniversary. I am a hockey nut and had to visit the Hockey Hall of Fame. We also had plans to see a Blue Jays game and have dinner at the CN Tower restaurant. This hotel is in such a fantastic location for all of the above. I was a little disappointed upon our arrival when the concierge handed us a flashlight and informed us that all electricity would be turned off between the hours of 11pm and 5am. No biggie for us since we had just arrived after a nine hour drive and went straight to bed. The rooms are very nice, very modern with a comfortable bed. The rooms are equipped with tiny kitchenettes and I wish I had made a pit stop at a grocery store before checking in to the hotel for snacks. Paying $4.50 for a bottle of water and $3 bucks for a Clif Bar is outrageous. Another tip... don't bother paying the $30 a night fee for valet parking at the hotel. Drive down a block or two and park in the garage. We did and paid $38 bucks for the three days we spent in Toronto. A bargain! If you want a clean, modern hotel in a great location, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “great stay -great location”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryScot
Reviews.Content: really enjoyed this place--very close to Yonge street - near subway-super central location for walking to attractions-the hotel itself was excellent-huge room and nice modern furnishing and decor. Would definitely return here on my next trip to toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance”
Reviews.Author: V3ronica
Reviews.Content: Staff didn't seem to care, wireless internet was expensive, and there were holes in the sheets and duvet cover. Orange coloured hallways were very dim and unpleasant. Not enough lighting in the room, especially for the bathroom mirror. Food was ok, but overpriced, and the air conditioning in my room kept turning off in the middle of the night. Elevators have disco lighting and don't work particularly well.

Reviews.Title: “funky atmosphere, OK stay”
Reviews.Author: susanregina
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable and pretty clean. The staff were OK upon check-in, but service did not seem to be an overall priority. I felt a little strange in the hallways, as they were very dark and had kind of a nightclub/bondage chamber feel to them; but the room itself was very nice (I was upgraded to a suite because they had run out of the standard guest rooms). I checked in late at night (i.e. after 10) and was a little shocked to be told that there was a scheduled power outage for the evening (11:30- 6 AM) for maintenance. After traveling all day and feeling extremely tired while looking forward to just resting and relaxing in my room for a bit, I felt quite stressed to get my shower done before the scheduled power outage. I felt that I should have been notified beforehand, or given some kind of discount for having to deal with this inconvenience, but the staff seemed unconcerned about all this. Overall, I think that this place would be good for a young couple who were coming for a romantic getaway who wouldn't mind things out of place here, who weren't expecting stellar service, and wjp there who were coming into Toronto primarily to go out at night, but it would be totally inappropriate for a family with children or anyone who was expecting a full-service hotel with excellent customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant - 10 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: Roamingabout
Reviews.Content: As a seasoned traveller this was a brilliant experience. It may not be everyone's cup of tea as the hotel offers up alot of dark shadow lighting to communal areas and also alot of mauve and darker neon coloured lighting. That aside - cant recommend it enough. Various comments would be chic, eclectic, bohemian - take your pick. The service makes this hotel stand out. Some of the best I have ever received. Dont get me wrong - they want to take your dollar but it's subtle and they cant do enough for you. If you requested the concierge abseil down the building then he probably would just to please you. Check out the room guide book - one of the most informative, useful and best written I have ever come across. Fantastic location - bang in the middle of Downtown at Dundas and the Eaton centre. Excellent maid service. Breakfast is extra but brilliantly executed by the Breakfast Bar waitress. The evening Martini bar appears to be a hip hang out for guests as well as locals and there is one cocktail waitress ( an actress I understand) who is simply sensational in customer service.
