Didnt try the attached restaurant so cant comment but felt completely relaxed in a wonderful unusual environment. I am a fussy guest but no complaints from me on this one. The other half loved it as well. They put to shame alot of the traditional high end hotels. This isn't cheap but then you aren't getting cheap service or style. Well worth the money and then some. Seems to attract in age range those in 20's through to mid 40's who aren't quite ready for the pipe and slippers!!

Reviews.Title: “valentines retreat with success”
Reviews.Author: bro12345
Reviews.Content: we went for valentines it was a great hotel, not much else left to day. -breakfast was great -spa was great -hotel ambience was a little weird as it was always dark (didnt really bother me though) -hotel room was more than great -a little pricey great experience

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: agc127
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, it's very hip and trendy, and located right by dundas square and the eaton centre. Perfect dt location! If you want to go to a few clubs, it's only about a 20min walk from the entertainment district, so not far at all. The spa is also wonderful which I highly reccommend, and you also get a 15% discount from the hotel when you check in! Along with free golf for 2. The martini bar is very chic which is just located in the lobby, the rooms are spacious and convienent for a long stay if you get the suites with the mini kitchen, and washer and dryer. Overall great stay, great location. perfect for younger travellers looking for something trendy!

Reviews.Title: “Very Central Pantages”
Reviews.Author: Mrs-Moondog
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in a great location, just a trot down the road to the Eaton Centre, and all that down town has to offer. We stayed in an Ambassador Suite, for the extra space, as you have a living room as as a separate bedroom. Very nice and clean and tidy, felt like staying in an appartment more than a hotel. Breakfast was included with our tariff, which was a very nice start to the day. Would recomend this hotel, as it puts you where you want to be, and has the space and kitchen to which gives you the flexiblity to chill out if the city has all been to much for one day!

Reviews.Title: “Great location that could use new staff”
Reviews.Author: cici-la
Reviews.Content: This review is a little late since my boyfriend and I stayed at the Pantages back in February 2009 but better late than never! We booked the hotel for a Friday night on the 20th since all other places were too expensive or had no vacancies for Valentine's day weekend (that's what you get for booking the night before). We got a really good deal through a corporate promotion and were excited since all the pictures we saw of the hotel were promising. Let me also get one thing straight before I continue. I am the kind of person who only visits 4+ star hotels. I like my hotels to be modern, but comfortable, in a great location and I expect to be treated like a valued guest everytime. Upon entering the hotel, the first thing I noticed was the lack of people, both guests and staff. I checked in around 3 pm and except for a very bored looking doorman and two chatty with-each-other receptionists, there was no-one else there. Checking in took some time since the two staff behind the counter just HAD to finish their personal chat before even bothering to notice me. Once I got their attention though, I was met with what I can only call disdain. Sorry to interrupt your conversation but yah, I'd like to check into my room please. Any question I asked was met with a "DUH" kind of look and answer. The lobby to the elevator was very dark and I had some difficulty getting there without knocking my bags into something (no bell hop came to my rescue though). However, once I stepped into the room, I was very happy. We got a deluxe room with its own kitchen and king sized bed. The view wasn't great, but at least we were above the construction happening across the street. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean, beautiful and with all the amenities I wanted (including a stereo with iPod dock). There was more room in there than I knew what to do with and the furniture and decor were exactly to my taste. The kitchen and fridge were well stocked though somewhat pricey. Later on in the evening, the bed was turned down when we returned from dinner. But when I noticed I forgot toothpaste and phoned down to the concierge for some, it took them over an hour and another call to get it to the room. Checking out was easy enough though I was met with the same boredom and total lack of friendliness that I'm used to from other 4 and even lower star rated hotels. So overall, this was a great hotel in a great location, but the staff could use an attitude adjustment.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it All!”
Reviews.Author: Elkeh
Reviews.Content: I have been staying for the 3rd time already at the Pantages and I have loved every minute of it. The staff is very friendly and professional, the rooms are beatiful and the location is right in the heart of the the City. You could not ask for anything better. Can't wait to go go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service With Amazing Spa”
Reviews.Author: axelsmith
Reviews.Content: The service was great, the receptionists were helpful, and kind. The martini bar is a must, the crowd is just inspiring. The design was great, the staff was excellent, thorough, the rooms were comfortable and cozy.

Reviews.Title: “not a pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: traintravelLondon
Reviews.Content: On the positive side, with washers, driers, dishwashers and ovens in the room, a homeless family could move right in. On the less positive side, until the hotel grasps the importance of cleanliness it might not be the most health promoting experience for them. Even before I pulled across the shower curtains and smelled the pee, (the shower curtain problem, as those who travel a lot will recognise, isn't uncommon), my heart had sunk on seeing the filthy windows, the gloomy lighting, the ragged dressing gowns, and the highly used in room menus with finergmarks of previous guests. Even more alarming was the management response that they 'couldn't' change shower curtains between every guest. Why not ? Sure, we all want to preserve the environment, but they presumably change the sheets. The manager wrote to say they were taking up the problem with relevant heads of department. - but the solution is in the hands of management. What are the cleaners supposed to do - jump in the shower, pull the curtain across and sniff to find out which guests have, and which have not, peed on the shower curtain before deciding which go into the wash ? My hosts were being charged over $170 a night, and only after I had been very insistent was the price of one night deducted from their bill, and that with rather poor grace. I moved to the Sheraton Centre which has great views, well-trained staff, and where you can see out of the clean windows (despite there being a lot more of them).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in very way!”
Reviews.Author: NIKKOLS
Reviews.Content: The Pantages Suites Hotel and Spa was practically perfect in every way!!!! The rooms were amazing, comfortable & clean. The bathroom was very roomy loved the eat in kitchen and the washer and dryer came in handy to. The service was wonderful, the staff friendly & helpful & it was a great location!! Close to shopping and the night life. I recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the Height of the my Suite i.e 4001. It was very cozy place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: ondwargaurav
Reviews.Content: I loved the Height of the my Suite i.e 4001. It was very cozy place to stay. bathoom was amazing. however I am not fully satisfied with the kitchen utnsils and henat Sensors. the heat sensor was very delicate and use to pick up even steams too. In all it was a pleasent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and service”
Reviews.Author: louloulemon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Pantages through a hotdeal at Expedia and thoroughly enjoyed our experience in a one bedroom suite. Felt like a pied-a-terre in a fabulous location. Friendly service, especially from all the parking valets. The continental breakfast which was included was excellent (delicious muffins, croissants, pastries, fruit, cereals, yogurt and Illy coffee).

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Pantages”
Reviews.Author: Jamie10s
Reviews.Content: This was a very pleasurable two days. The staff at reception and in the Martini Bar were extremely welcoming and went out of their way to see my stay was pleasurable. When I didn't answer my wake-up call, they sent someone to check on me - very professional. Liked all the goodies in the room, very convenient and well decorated for a downtown location. Will stay here everytime on business in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Skip the Spa!”
Reviews.Author: missymay
Reviews.Content: The spa was the complete opposite of a relaxing experience. Although the masseuse was good, this did not make up the extremely rude receptionist. She booked me for the wrong time and I was not told of this error until I was undressed and on the table. I ended up getting a 45 min massage but had to pay for the full 60 min and never got an apology.

Reviews.Title: “Try another hotel- Spa was a Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: spine1
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms but too many items in the room for sale-sort of felt like I was in a convenience sore. Staff was very friendly. Washer/drier in room was nice. Limited food availability- limited breakfast and room service.The spa was a complete waste of time-broken Jacuzzi, broken massage table and broken pedicure foot soak basin. It was the 2nd day for the masseuse/nail tech- I left more stressed out that when I went in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HayesAus
Reviews.Content: We booked one of the rooms in the residental section from a "managed apartment" service.... and would strongly recommend this method for anyone staying 5 days or more. The apartment was very nice, and had a fantastic amount of space after staying in hotels for the past 2 months with everything (apart from the bathroom) on the same room. The price we paid i thought was quite good (approx $120/night + tax) as far as value for money went.....the hotel part does look very very snobby, and we were happy we didnt have to deal with that. In short, if you can arrange a decent rate, this hotel is in a superb location and has very nice rooms (or at least the one we stayed in was - the hotel may be different) and is definately worth a look.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to Stay - Yoga Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: medtravel
Reviews.Content: Starting with the great rate that we got on Travelocity this hotel was very nice. The floors are pergo so it feels very clean just because of that but the room was clean. The rooms are nice and roomy, bathrooms had a whirlpool tub and a separate shower. In every room is a yoga mat with blocks. There is an umbrella which we made use of one night. Turndown service will leave you serenity stones on the pillow instead of chocolate but that was intersting to look forward to. I couldn't find the ice machines but they delivered ice to my room upon request. The location is great, just a block from the Eaton center, across the street from Massey Hall and the Senator resturant (the oldest in Toronto and a good place to go). We walked from the hotel to the Princess of Wales theater, it is about a 20 min walk but very walkable. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “July 25,26 2008 - "Just For Laughs Tour"”
Reviews.Author: RegularUserON
Reviews.Content: We stayed July 25 and 26 2008. Our room had laminate flooring, and that was a refreshing change. The suite was beautiful, the bed and linens were very comfortable and the hotel was modern and hip. Booking online through hotels.com was a nightmare though. For a local getaway in an area you are already familiar with, I would always recommend booking it yourself directly through the hotel that you are interested in. Third party booking agencies never seem to have up to date information. If not for the Manager of the Pantages taking care of us personally, our planned weekend getaway booked through hotels.com would have been a disaster. If you want to attend a performance at Massey Hall or something cool that is going on in Dundas Square or in downtown Toronto, Pantages Hotel is the place to be. You are only footsteps away from both locations, and it is very likely that the celebrities you want to see are actually staying at the Pantages with you. We saw most of the cast and crew of the Just For Laughs Tour in our hotel that weekend. We used one of the Spa packages and enjoyed it. I would recommend, however, that you always ask and make sure that your massage therapist is a "Registered Massage Therapist" to make certain you get the best possible massage. The steam room was not working while we were there and we found our change rooms very small, but the sauna, hot tub, pedicure and massage experiences we had were great. We thought the buffet breakfast in the bar was great, but the hotel is also attached to "Fran's" restaurant and it was very popular and more reasonably priced. We've stayed in the "Royal York Hotel" before and we think the Pantages Hotel was a far better experience, right in the heart of downtown Toronto. We will be using it again if we need to be right where the action is.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: sam7072
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Pantages numerous times and every time it has always been a wonderful experience. The staff are very courteous at the front door and the front desk. The lounge is very quaint and pleasant. On a weekend night the bar gets pretty busy and the band is pretty good. Love the fact that you can access Fran's for a quick bite! The rooms are very nicely decorated and they are very clean. Housekeeping staff is always warm, friendly and very courteous. Thanks for always making our stay very warm and welcome. We always look forward to going to Toronto and know that we have a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Prestige for Pantages!”
Reviews.Author: nalliecat
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Pantages Hotel in Toronto was sensational right from the instant the valet opened my door at the beginning of my stay to the moment he closed the door, as I sadly left. Being warmly welcomed by two delightful Guest Service agents as I checked in was a sign of how all the employees treated me throughout my 4 day stay. My deluxe suite greeted me with the comforts of my own home - duvet, flat-screen televisions, bathrobes, hair dryers, full size refrigerator, stove top range, toaster, coffee maker, microwave, dishwasher and wireless internet. More importantly, the Pantages Hotel is located in one of the most convenient locations in Toronto. Just steps away from the Eaton Centre, Dundas Square, Queen Street and public transportation, allowing me to accomplish everything that I wanted to do while visiting Toronto. I even managed to squeeze in time at the spa for a massage. I would be hard-pressed to find another hotel in Toronto that would be able to meet my needs and expectations as well as the Pantages Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than many”
Reviews.Author: othello12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four days. Yes the rooms are smaller. But they include a well stocked kitchen with a full-size fridge; nice convienence. Location - one block off of Yonge and Eaton Centre. No hassles experienced with people on street as suggested by another reviewer. In fact location is very central and access to major attractions quite simple. This is a boutique hotel - more trendy, less traditional. I like this approach; provides variation from the standard. But don't expect the familiarity that comes from staying with "chains." Bed and linens were comfortable. One stain on bedspread was off-putting but not that significant. Staff were mostly very friendly, efficient. Maid service was hit and miss; bed and towels always clean, turn-down service was appreciated. But our floor (hardwood) was not swept during the stay which was frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “management & staff thinks that they are more important than their clien”
Reviews.Author: jhonnyhome
Reviews.Content: the hotel is nice and I like the downtown location- Toronto is great we were impressed with the hotel email,1 week before our stay, informing that they couldnot wait to see us and asking about our special drinks & magazin (fantastic!!) we noticed some minor problems and had A major problem with breakfast as personal overslept . We received an survey and got a reply from David Zalzman,the manager ,that he couldnot believe that we were talking abt his hotel,but the next day he confirmed our remarks and he was hoping to see us next time in his sister hotel.They refused us to compensate for not available breakfast service and when I complaint THEY BLOCKED MY EMAILS (THEY BLOCKED MY IP) The problems where minor but should not excist in a 4 star hotel and not even in a 2 star hotel. The staff refused to do anything,after massage had to go to my room to get money as couldnot charge to the room, the Spa is a mini wirepool,no slippers available and had to leave without breakfast after waiting til 7.25 (breakfast from 7am!!) But the handeling of these complaints was terrible, unheard, unprofesional and without respect for the guest. I would never ever advise this Toronto Pantages Hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but nice”
Reviews.Author: Lederfrau
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for, lovely rooms, great ambiance. If you just want a room to sleep it this may not be for you. This is an upscale place for young professionals rather than a family hotel. I look for places that are better for singles and child-free couples and this suits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Small friendly hotel near theatres”
Reviews.Author: cinderella50
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located for a show at Massey Hall or the Canon Theatre - no need for a taxi. We stayed in a "serenity" suite on the 4th floor. Soft lighting, fountains, serene music. Very comfortable king sized bed with duvet and lots of pillows. Rain shower in the bathroom was great, although the jacuzzi tub didn't look that clean. The staff we encountered were all very friendly - maid, parking attendant, front desk clerk. The continental breakfast was very good. High quaility teas and coffee, fresh fruit, yogurt, pastries, waffles and very nice cheese. It is a short walk to the Eaton's Centre and Yonge street for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “A Major Let Down”
Reviews.Author: T-dot_Traveller_76
Reviews.Content: This review has taken awhile, but I will share my experience with you. In October 2006 my wife and I were getting married. We were looking for a nice hotel at a decent price where we could spend our wedding night. After checking a number of hotels, we were very satisified with the Pantages (in terms of price, room size, layout, etc...), and decided to book it at least 3 months prior to the actual night we needed it. Everything seemed to be in order, I even received an email from the Manager a week before our stay saying that everything was taken care of, and I had more important things to worry about then the hotel. On Wedding Night, we arrived at the hotel and recevied the keys to a room not the one we had selected. I asked if this was the same room, and the front staff said it was 'similar'. When we got to the room there was nothing similar about the room. I called back down to front desk and was told that someone had taken the room we had wanted, and left their belongings which meant that the hotel staff could not remove it. At this point I was thoroughly disgusted. I will admit that the hotel manager did get on the line with us and said he would do whatever it took to make us feel better. He said he would comp us for the room, however, that really wasn't what we were looking for. Eventually we ended up going to the Cosmopolitan which is a sister company of their's (which they comped), but the whole experience left us very bitter. After returning from our honeymoon I sent the Manager an email stating how dissapointed I was in their service and the fact that I never even received an apology letter. She did send me an apology letter after and called me as well to tell me how sorry she was, but it wasn't enough. It's been more than a year since this incident has happened, and the experience still leaves a bad taste in my mouth. I strongly urge all potential guests of this property to book elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service Great rooms Great location”
Reviews.Author: sharpielvs
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. The staff is friendly and professional. The hotel is clean and well appointed. We booked a superior room but upgraded when we got there into a room with a big living room and separate bedroom. Somehow they found out we were celebrating my birthday and they sent a nice cake and even sang! The people who work there look like they are having fun and they were so helpful in directing us to the best shopping and dining experiences. This was my first time in a boutique hotel but it will not be my last!!! The rooms had a washer and dryer and a kitchen. The hardwood floors were really nice. We had a great time at Pantages and will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and overrated in a shabby neigbourhood”
Reviews.Author: cocochaneltoronto
Reviews.Content: Booked the place through Expedia based on reviews and advice from friends who stayed there. What a mistake ! This place is in a BAD neighborhood. It is on a small street near Yonge and Dundas and some creepy characters are constantly passing by demanding money or simply giving you the look. Room was awful - small as a shoe box and overlooking a dirty rooftop with some machinery on top. We have asked for another room and were brushed off by front desk staff who had difficulty speaking English. Save your money ! AVOID THIS PLACE !

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Little Boutique”
Reviews.Author: ChaShu
Reviews.Content: Nice little boutique hotel. Very central to many of Toronto's attractions and a quick subway or streetcar ride away from many others. The suites were very nicely appointed with modern furniture and kept clean. The small kitchenette was a nice touch for people who wanted to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Not as expected...”
Reviews.Author: marialbuquerque
Reviews.Content: There are many things that have to be renovated and repaired on the room: many things on the bathroom, walls to be painted, furniture and lamps to be well cleaned... The decoration, particularly on the bathroom, was sloppy. Examples: the wash-basin was not glued on the wall; there was a support for 2 candles on the wall, but there was only one candle... The view from my room was unqualified - to a dirty and dark back of the building. Good things: The bed was big and very comfortable, and the room had good dimensions too. Some people of the staff were very kindly. Great location too. The lobby is too dark and small. We arrived at night, so it was not very comfortable and cozy to get to the hotel, as we wishedâ€¦ The runners are also dark and not very well cleaned and treated. The decoration is to dark and not very comfortable. When we arrived at our room, just in front of our door there was an opened door to the stairs, with dirty dishes of the room service on the groundâ€¦ The breakfast is poor for the supposed quality of the hotel. After my stay on this hotel, I stayed on the Novotel Toronto Centre, which has a smaller rate, and I had a wonderful breakfast, on a much more decent and bigger room. I confess I got surprised, because on the internet, this one looked like one of the most modern and sophisticated hotels at Toronto (it is not so easy to find a sophisticated at Torontoâ€¦).

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: PunxsutawneyPhil
Reviews.Content: Tired after a transatlantic flight from UK, the hotel was a quiet oasis. Arrival was smooth (used the valet parking, bit expensive at $30) and check-in was efficient (even though we were bit early). Stayed in a deluxe suite (booking via travelzoo) and we were absolutely delighted with the room. Immaculate, spacious and quiet. Unexpectedly the room also had a washing machine/dryer with complimentary powders etc which was a convenience for us! No time for us to use the spa so no comment on that! Breakfast was simple verging on basic but came with the package so can't complain I guess. Served in lobby (which is really small) and bit chilly (a/c setting questionable) but nice enough. Staff were pleasant, courteous and helpful throughout. It's a really nice place, close to the Eaton shopping mall and convenient for most city centre pursuits also. Loved it! Wouldn't hesitate to use it again or recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: maxben111
Reviews.Content: It seems like people have had bad experiences here, but I really couldn't find a single fault in my whole stay! I mean, the room was beautiful and everything worked like it should. The staff were attentive and very helpful. The food was, though not top notch, well priced and very nice. And, best for me, the hotel was in a great location at queen and yonge, right beside the Eaton Centre and from where I could go anywhere in downtown toronto easily. The point is, this was a flawless stay and I really don't understand why people were unhappy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, really made our holiday”
Reviews.Author: maccorq
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel after a 14hr journey to a warm welcome. Stayed in a deluxe suite (worked out the same price as a reg rm by booking with travelocity) and we were absolutely delighted with the room. Immaculate, spacious and lovely views. Contrary to previous comment, we both used the spa and found it an excellent experience, discounts offered to guests at hotel. Breakfast was great, continental came with package and was more than enough. There was a complimentary turn-down service in evenings. Staff were only ever helpful and friendly. Totally made our stay, would recommend to everyone. It really was first class.

Reviews.Title: “A FUN. Trendy, Hip Girlfriends Week-end”
Reviews.Author: StephanieinOntario
Reviews.Content: It was my friends 40th and we wanted to head to Toronto for the week-end. I found this hotel on Expedia and it looked good on-line and looked good when we arrived. Our room was huge, full kitchen, decent bathroom, and decorated well. VERY quiet hotel, as it is all plush carpeting, and padded beds. Great location for night life, however we did get lost. Front Desk gave us the wrong directions. Went to JUMP for dinner, and then a nightclub. breakfast was the best! Downstairs in the diner.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Weekend”
Reviews.Author: soontobeforty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pantages in Toronto late August to celebrate our 15th anniversary. The hotel is centrally located near many shopping areas, theatres, and near the subway. We booked a superior room through Continental.com but when we were checked in, we were upgraded to a deluxe suite with a kitchenette and nice view. The hotel is modern and comfy. The fitness center is more than adequate. Breakfast was excellent with lots of choices. Drinks at the Martini Bar were refreshing and relaxing after a hard day of shopping. Our bed was oh so comfortable! I would stay here every time I'm in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “average stay, central location”
Reviews.Author: dmpls79
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Toronto for 4 nights, 2 nights at SOHO metropolitan and 2 here at Pantages. So basically doing almost a comparison between the two. Pantages was on a very busy street not the best looking location BUT very central to Eaton Centres and Atrium on the Bay, Canon Theatre, etc. The rooms were acceptably clean. Rooms are like the pictures except that everything seem to be "older" . Might be a little harsh for this review since we stayed at the SOHO Metropolitan too which was almost perfect.

Reviews.Title: “This is a nice place”
Reviews.Author: skibucks
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and is in the heart of Toronto, near shopping, shows and nice restaurants. Most of it within walking distance but if not the subway is very close by. The staff was kind at check in and provided a complimentary upgrade for us. They have a continental breakfast that is very sufficient, unless you want bacon and eggs. It had fruit, cheese, bread, cereal, and danish. The lobby to the hotel is a little small, but you aren't staying in the lobby so who cares. I would come back here if I travel to toronto again.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel/Good Value”
Reviews.Author: IAH_traveler
Reviews.Content: Centrally located in the heart of downtown Toronto with easy access to main streets and subway stops. The look of the hotel is contemporary and hip, without the big price of other boutique hotels in Toronto (especially now---with the strong Canadian dollar). Nice sized rooms and the wood laminate floors are much better than having carpet...large bathrooms as well. Nice lighting and furniture, bed was really comfortable, nice soaps and the jacuzzi tub was a plus. Nice to have an option with the shower stall and separate spa tub. It was fun having the bar downstairs for a pre-going out place to stop for a drink or nightcap. Continental breakfast did the job and if you want a full breakfast, Fran's next door has great pancakes. All in all, a great stay and I'd stay again. The staff is a bit aloof, but they got the job done, so...I'd just been to Chicago & stayed at the Burnham, where the staff is really friendly and fantastic, so perhaps that's why it was quite a contrast.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice.”
Reviews.Author: Ontarioannie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful at check-in. Valet service was good with prompt delivery of our car when we needed it. The room had a queen size bed which was very comfortable. The room was equipped with apartment-sized refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave and stove top. Dishes, cutlery and pots were available. Bathroom was ordinary but clean with nice bath amenities. The turn-down service was a nice touch! We also found our room to be very quiet. We did not hear street noise or anything from other rooms or the hallway - this made our stay very peaceful. One thing that actually bothered us was that the lobby elevators are situated in a corridor that is incredibly dark. While I enjoy 'mood' lighting - we found this area so dark that we could hardly see. However, the corridors on the floors are well lit. I had a massage treatment at the spa. We also received a 15%spa discount coupon at check-in, which was a nice surprise. Frankly, I have had better massages, however, the spa is well appointed and the staff friendly. I thought that the change room was poorly designed because the change room door opens directly into the change room so anyone passing by can see in if that door is opened. Consequently, you might want to change in one of the washroom cubicles. We listened to jazz at the Martini bar. The piano and trumpet player were very good and the drinks and service were also good. The best thing about this hotel is the location.It is GREAT! - walking distance to theatres, shopping and dining. We will be booking again near Christmas to do some of our shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey...but Worth It!”
Reviews.Author: ywtchr
Reviews.Content: I quickly got over the fact that my King size ambassador suite wasn't available and I was given a queen size suite, but after 5 minutes on site, I didn't care. This hotel is fantastic! Staying here you may bump into celebrities (we bumped into rapper T.I. on the way into the hotel)! The location is fantastic. There's a fantastic spa on site. The staff is great. I stayed here for 17 days in July and was at home. The accept AAA and CAA discounts. If you want to avoid the rising cost of taxis or airport shuttles, arrive by lincoln towncar or limo using AIRLINK LIMO SERVICE - Ilahi will be more than happy to assist you for a mere $50-$60 CDN. The best staffers are: Front door: Chris, Jeff, David, James Desk: Stephen, Tina and Ibrahim I'm not at home so I can't load photos now but will try to do it in a week or so. The downsides are: * there is no pool * Canadian taxes are like 15% (there are 2 taxes). I forgot to account for this ****They hold for incidentals in advance...$150/day. This I didn't know about***** When we went CDN and US $ were about equal so I didn't have as good a spending experience as in past years but it's definitely worth it. If I can afford to, can save up and/or get a nice tax refund, I will definitely be back. It's good to treat yourself sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bijou2006
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business for 3 nights. Reservation via hotel web site: no problem. Check-in: was late (around 9pm) but desired type of room was waiting. Room: nice; bed:good & comfortable; bathroom good; my room has kitchen (though didn't use much) Internet: for a fee (around $12), connection could have been better Breakfast: nice continental breakfast served on the ground floor; there is also a coffee shop adjacent to the hotel (but would not recommend)

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place ! Bad location - Spooky people nearby ! Unfriendly, Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: David_Mina
Reviews.Content: Wanted to book a suite at Pantages this April as we have read a few comments about it It is very hard to deal with the staff there. They put you on hold and talk to you like they are paying you and doing you a favor... They said that they have availability, then said, that they didn't - two days before our relatives arrived. DID NOT EVEN say sorry. AWFUL people. Good thing we did not stay there, because when we drove by the place, spooky people where nearby - apparently the neighborhood is rough

Reviews.Title: “They cancelled my reservation the evening before my arrival”
Reviews.Author: WynnewoodPA
Reviews.Content: The evening of the day before my scheduled arrival the hotel called and said they were overbooked because a large group was extending their stay and so they would not have my reserved room for me for the first night of a two night stay. I chose this hotel for its downtown location and supposedly relaxing luxury atmosphere. The hotel's general manager offered only to put me at a substandard Holiday Inn in Yorkville, far from the downtown area. They were just too cheap to put me in a comparable hotel. Despite their assertions that the city was completely booked I was able to book a comparable hotel through Orbitz. Because of the last minute booking I had little choice and had to pay more for my room. If you really need to stay in Toronto don't depend on a reservation at the Pantages. They do not provide an adequate alternative if they cannot honor a reservation. Additionally should you mention that the hotel might be mismanaged, the staff is likely to verbally attack you, the guest, rather than apologize for the inconvenience their mismanagement has caused.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the negative reviews-GREAT hotel”
Reviews.Author: karma318
Reviews.Content: I always utilize tripadvisor when staying at a new hotel. I had mixed feelings about this hotel but chose to give it a chance anyway...Wow was I surprised. The short of it is that the hotel is great, the service is great, and the bar is great. I truly believe that people who go into a hotel with a negative attitude will come out with a negative attitude. First, if you stay in downtown Toronto, you will hear an ambulance or helicopter from time to time (we never did hear a helicopter). Even though the hotel is within one block of the hospital, the noises were no different then when we stay at any other hotel in Toronto (we travel to Toronto many times a year and have stayed at a lot of hotels). Also, the floors may not be real hardwoods but could you imagine the maintenance involved with real hardwood in a hotel ... Laminate floors are just as nice. And lastly, the one common comment was that the service was horrible and that is simply not true. We walked into the hotel and were greeted by very nice,welcoming people. They asked for the reason for our stay and we told them that we were celebrating our one year anniversary a little early. She immediately handed me two cards for free drinks in the Martini Bar (YUMMY)! Then we got to our room and it was spotless. There was a small leak in the sink and they immediately fixed it. They even offered to change our room for the inconvenience but we declined because our room was fine. So in the end, it is a very nice place to stay in downtown for the price, the service is excellent, the Martini Bar is open normal hours, the proximity is perfect, and it is worth a try!

Reviews.Title: “People Should Stop Their Complaining”
Reviews.Author: msmorrisdet
Reviews.Content: I was impressed. The rooms were a exact replica of the picture online. The staff was great and helpful. The location was superb. I have yet to see a hotel that was perfect. Just because you had a bad day, doesn't mean that you should deter people from experiencing a quality establishment. I think they put a lot of thought and care into the design and operation of the hotel. The spa was great. I even saw a celeb there! Sometimes I waited on hold a while before I was able to speak with a spa employee but the treatment was so worth it. I highly recommend checking this place out.

Reviews.Title: “The bar says it all...”
Reviews.Author: Caethan
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the hotel a few times now and it has always been ok. I usually don't bother looking for anywhere else to stay because of the location (practically the only thing that is going for this hotel). This was and will be the last time I stay at this hotel for good reason. 1. The doormen are usually very nice and helpful, but this last time I came for a later than usual check-in. The desk clerks were more than happy to assist me and were very friendly but you could just tell they didn't have the resources to help their guests. It appears the management decided that they would rather put their money in this ugly mesh netting that separates the bar from the entrance way than to hiring enough staff to accomodate this overly high-priced hotel. 2. The bar layout was ok before, but this time it looked like they hired some 10 year-old to move the furniture around... it looked like a garage sale. I could barely tell where the bar started and the hotel ended. As my title suggests this was the trend of things to come. 3. The room was medicore at best, clean and accomodating but on my way upstairs I ran into a older woman with a yappy dog who decided it was ok to bark at my briefcase. 4. I thought that I would head downstairs to the bar and was met by the most pretentious bartenders in the world. This blonde bartender whome I will not name was less than customer service oriented and was more concerned with talking about guests behind their back and feeling it was ok to talk down to the customers. He never once said a word to me while serving me! Talk about stone cold "I'm better than you" attitude. 5. I couldn't take this wanna-be high end hotel for more than one night and just had to pack my stuff and leave. Thank goodness that I found better hotel service and a more comfortable room right down the street (AT 1/3 the cost mind you!) If you ask me about Pantages... it appears the staff are well trained (except the blonde one behind the bar, if you see him go down the street to the Senator, it's cheaper and better). The management however have no idea how to run a hotel. It appears that in the recent months they've found a way to make the hotel look cheap, feel cheap, but cost way too much. I'd rather sleep on the streets, at least I won't have dogs barking and bartenders staring me down.

Reviews.Title: “I had great time while visiting toronto”
Reviews.Author: TakenLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to everything, the best theaters(canon theater) the best mall(Eaton center) the staff are nice and spa refreshing and the rooms are large and equipped with every thing you need. if you are visiting Toronto this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hip and Sleek”
Reviews.Author: anneablue
Reviews.Content: Very cool hotel. We had a studio suite with a queen bed and kitchen on the 15th floor. The room was beautiful and the location central. The staff was friendly and helpful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!! 10/10”
Reviews.Author: MIRVISH
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked us in at the Pantages the weekend of Feb 10th. We were meant to leave on the 12th and had to Niagara Falls. We were so pleased with the hotel and felt so cozy there that we decided to extend our stay for Valentine's Day. we felt so comfortble in our room it was almost like our own condo in T.O. It definetely has the WOW factor that our friend reccomended it would. The loby and Martini Bar is stunning, they have live Jazz on the weekend where we laid back on the sofa's and enjoyed while sipping their "signature martinis". The staff really take prode in the establishment and it shows. Great service. The rooms I cannot say enough about..... All amazing, from the beds to the decor. THUMBS WAY UP TO THE PANTAGES AND ALL THE STAFF.... YOU SHOULD KNOW THAT WE STAYED LONGER THEN WE WERE MEANT TO BECAUSE OF YOU! I can't wait to return. Too bad there are not any more Pantages around the world for others (not staying in T.O) to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Traveller071
Reviews.Content: If you like hearing ambulance's and helicopters this is the place for you - conveniently located beside a hospital! Upon arrival the front staff were clearly not in a good mood. When it was finally our turn to check in we were informed that the room we booked was not available. (reservations are useless here) So we had to stay in a smaller 1 bedroom. We had no other choice but to accept. The staff was extremly unapologetic and not helpful - they looked at us as if we were in the wrong. The lady at the desk said we would receive a discount for this inconvenience - in the end we never did. The rooms are alright, everything about the hotel is alright. I have stayed in plenty of hotels in Toronto and believe me there are way better ones for the same price/ amenities. The Spa is also nothing to rave about. Its hard to relax when you can here the helicopters landing at the hospital beside you. I found my service was very rushed and the staff were alright. All and all I didn't let this terrible hotel ruin my weekend. Toronto is a great city with so much to do. I just would advise any travellers to this city to avoid this hotel - there are tons of great hotels in Toronto other then the Pantages.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money unless you are looking for a great bed!!”
Reviews.Author: muffandme
Reviews.Content: Stayed in suite for honeymoon (living room, kitchen, bedroom (separate from kitchen/living room) + Bed was fantastic -- large, luxurious, 600 thread count white cotton linens. If you are allergic to down feathers normally, you won't be with this thread count. + Kitchen was quite nice. + Roomy + Bathroom amenities were nice - couch sucked -- very uncomfortable and cheap. - had to ask for second bathrobe & the rose petals/wine wasn't ready in our room - had to book with the spa for our package, the hotel didn't handle it - had to ask for spa discount coupon (honeymoon package) when at spa (not seamless) and they didn't seem to have that together -- the spa and hotel are NOT connected in any way other than they run promo's together and are in the same building. - spa ripped us off but the services (except for the couples massages) were fantastic. We thought we would be side by side (as the picture shows but we were placed on an angle head by head... it wasn't nice. Some great touches but the RMT massage was extremely lackluster. Facial and pedicure were great. The price WAS right, now it's expensive. Better spa places to go in Toronto than this! - noise if want to open window for fresh air - billed a $1000 deposit that wasn't lifted from our credit card for 7 days!!!! Very bad when travelling. We were not told about this at the front desk!! - Had to pay for every little thing, down to the water on the side tables -- I think the laundry detergent was free though (weird since everything else wasn't -- what a tease!!) - Shower was lackluster, water not nice or warm. - Watched like a hawk upon re-entering and exiting -- uncomfortable pretentious feeling. - wouldn't let us stay a half hour more in our hotel room when we were told that option might be available because of our honeymoon status. No reason given but a NO, SORRY! - OVERPRICED Obviously the pluses outweight the minus'. Don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “great ambience, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: tessyy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had stayed once before and the second visit was just as good as the first. Bell service was right there as we walked in to take our bags and a young woman at front desk named Lora was quick and helpful. Overall the feel of the hotel is classy and welcoming, with comfortable rooms and staff that greets you by name. The bartender Pheebs remembered us and our preferred drinks from our previous stay - delightful and accomodating! Minutes away from the Eatons Shopping Centre and restaurants right downtown, the location couldn't be better. There was only one problem when we were there, which was the television remote/tv but guest services was able to fix the problem quickly.

Reviews.Title: “One great Night”
Reviews.Author: Spongebum
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervouse about booking this hotel, based on some of the negative reviews but the pictures looked wonderful and so we decided to try it for ourselves. Valet parking was a litte expensive but it was worth it when our car came to us already warmed up for the trip home - it was freezing outside. Check in was great, very friendly, quick. Room was really nice and all of the staff that we ran into - even in the elevator were friendly and helpful. The spa is superb! The jasmine tea was excellent as were the pedicures. Previous reviews complained about difficulty with changing appointments but I had to change a couple of times with no issues at all. The only thing missing in our room was a second housecoat and the price list of in room treats. The beds were sooo comfortable we didn't want to get up the next day. The only other negative to mention is the hotel bar hours - very short and room service drinks are way too overpriced so bring your own - there's lots of room in the fridge! We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the Heart of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Flashart
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel with large suites and polite staff. We only had one problem during our family stay, as you need to choose your suite with care - some are next to permanent residents, who may come and go, with friends, which happended to us one night with noise at 4.45am. Other than that the city centre location is great, its not too noisy, barring the odd emergency helicopter landing at the hospital next door. The rooms are large, with kitchenettes and lots of hanging space. The Ambassador suite in particular, is worth it for a family (you can haggle an upgrade to one). The Martini Bar is nothing to write home about. Parking is expensive at $30 per night... and Fran's is OK but nothing special. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Spa and staff”
Reviews.Author: cfib
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel on business, and found that the front desk staff was far to preoccupied chatting with their fellow workers, therefore not paying to much attention to me. The suites are fantastic, very clean. It reminded me very much of the Boutique Hotels in New York City. I had the opportunity to visit the Spa while I was there, and had a relaxation massage, with Nadia. This girl is beautiful, and has the touch of an angel. It was the best massage I have ever had, and I travel a lot, and always make a point of visiting the Spa if there is one in the Hotel. I found the staff at the Spa was extremely attentive and very welcoming. The decor is rich and warm, reminds me of the 5 star spas in Europe. I will be back. I loved it. Thanks Pantages Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kevin31
Reviews.Content: My wfie and I were first time travelers to Toronto and I was concerned about the split of reviews on this site between "great" and it "stinks." I booked a long weekend in October through Travelocity at under $200 a night US. Hotel is a very solid 3 1/2 to 4 star hotel. Concierge had champagne in the room (wife's birthday) and also arranged a car pick up for my mife and I at the airport. You don't need a car in Toronto. Check in was a breeze, although the lobby area is a very small space... on a busy weekend, I can see how the entrance could become very crowded and check-in could become frustrating as others here have complained. We had a standard room with a very comfortable King bed. Bathroom is small, but I'd have to guess that the hotel rooms are probably converted studio apartments. We had no use for the kitchenette but it could be a nice touch for others. Location is exceptional. One block from the Eaton Center and literally 200 feet from the Canon Theater where we watched Wicked. Everyplace we went during the weekend was within a 20 minute walk. For those looking for places to eat -- the best meal we had during the weekend was at the Pure Spirits Oyster House in the Distillery District. Spent an afternoon in the Pantages Spa which was very relaxing. Not quite a 5-star spa but very worth the $$. Downsides -- the Martini bar is nice but expensive and the hotel doesn't have enough staff in the bar if it is crowded. There is no hotel restaurant - therefore no free continental breakfast like many hotels - so you have to include the cost of breakfast into your budgeting. Didn't bother us at all, but it is worth knowing. The hotel does have a door directly into an adjacent very nice diner - but it is separate from Patages. Overall, I didn't want to spend the $250-$300+ a night to stay at the SoHo, Four Season, Le Germain, etc. We had no problems with our stay and at $200 a night, I'd return to the Pantages Hotel without any concnerns. Hope you find this helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough good things about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: CorporateTrainer
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. From the excellent staff, the upscale lobby and facilities, the turn down service, or the semi-precious stones they leave on your pillows instead of chocolate. This spa and hotel is a must for anyone staying in Toronto for any reason. The location is great, in the middle of the theater district. And it's easy to get most anywhere in the city from the hotel. I love staying at this hotel and will try to stay there every time I'm in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, the staff are great”
Reviews.Author: kolmex
Reviews.Content: I must say my stay at the Pantages was outstanding thank to a couple KEY staff members. Firstly I was greeted by a funny yet informative valet named Robert, he helped us with our bags took car of the car and even offered to throw the loose coffee cups out. Suprisingly when we forgot some CD's in the car he was more then happy to bring them up to our suite. Parking is a bit pricy but they allow you to come and go as you like. Secondly Lara was just great she was the front desk agent but I tell you she does about everything there, if I had a concern she had the right people there to help me out. Andy our concierge helped get the room ready for me when I proposed to my now wife. He had set up for chocolate covered strawberries candles all over the room a bubble bath and more he was great. If yo go to this hotel make sure to ask for them by name I'm sure they'd love to hear from you it almost as if they have fun with what they do.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: richardY
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed at the pantages hotel. it was probably our best hotel stay. the rooms were very nice and modern, the service was good, the staff were friendly. there was also a bar at the lobby which was a nice touch. we stayed over the weekend and on one of the nights there was some music in the lobby which made comng back to the hotel feel good the hotel was a few minutes walk from eaton center and allot of restaurants, which was very convenient. we checked the hotels spa but did not get a chance to try out their services all in all, it is a very nice hotel, we will definitely try and stay there again and recommend other visitors to give it try

Reviews.Title: “WORST Hospitality experience of my life!!”
Reviews.Author: mail4ajc
Reviews.Content: On May 25 2006, I attempted to book reservations online, via the Pantages website. It didn't work. After contacting the hotel directly I booked lodging and accommodations for a group of seven adults from August 12-August 13, 2006. I was quoted rates for 2 Ambassador Suites, equipped with 1 King bed and 1 Queen sized pull out couch per room. One room was to accommodate 4 adults, the other 3 adults. Rooms were to be on the same floor, and in very close proximity to each other, with the possibility of 1 room in between the 2 suites. Base rate for the suites was $299 per room at double occupancy, with a $35 per adult fee charged for additional guests to cover the cost of additional toiletries, linens and bedding. My first irritation occured when I found out the online specials/packages they had posted didn't apply as I'd booked via phone. When I explained that the site wouldn't let me complete reservations, the reservations clerk told me it was because my request was complicated. Putting 7 adults in 2 suites that each accomodate 4 people doesn't sound complex to me...but whatever....the website looked great, and I was hoping this was just an anomoly. When we arrived at the hotel things declined more quickly than I can even describe--here's a *short* list of the issues: 1.Upon arrival, well past the guaranteed check-in time of 3:00PM rooms were unavailable and I was informed that a city-wide sellout for available rooms was in effect due to several major conferences. I had no choice but to wait. 2. My party was forced to wait more than 3 hours to be outfitted with rooms, and was offered no alternative or temporary arrangement while waiting. Literally we were sitting in lobby disheveled and travel weary from our trip to Toronto. 3. Car had to be valet parked with luggage in the vehicle as room wasn't ready at advertised check in time. Retrieval of luggage was not assisted; I had to carry bags the distance from parking garage to rooms. 4. Rooms were to be on the same floor. Rooms were on the 14th and 16th floors. 5. Housekeeping was still in room at time of entry, just before 8:00PM. 6. King beds were booked, queen beds were provided in both rooms. 7. Suite with 3 guests had bath linens & toiletries for 2. Suite with 4 guests had bath linens and toiletries for 2, bathrobe for 1, 1 extra pillow provided 8. Though all seven guests were recorded, 2 room keys per room were provided. 9. All reservations booked under single name, yet front desk refused to communicate room number to other room. 10. Linens for pull out bed were shoddy and worn--topped with a faded acrylic throw. Hardly the luxurious 400 thread count linens mentioned multiple times in marketing materials and on your website. 11. Rooms were significantly smaller and less furnished than depicted in online tour and photos and descriptions. 12. Room for 4 was very unkempt and notably devoid of most furnishings: a. No bar stools provided b. Artwork & mirrors missing--hanging studs exposed c. No end table d. In-room services binder was defaced and scribbled in e. Phone was missing all marker keys (no idea which button controlled which function) f. Door handle/lock on bedroom was broken g. Carpet was stained and dirty throughout As soon as I became aware of these problems, I reported them to hotel management, who personally observed the described problems. Situation was also explained to the general manager, who was on vacation at the time, as soon as possible. None of these representatives were able to offer any sort of restitution or apology--and most hotel representatives acted as though I was out of order. I am sickened that I paid $800 to such an unhospitable, poorly run facility for rooms that were occupied for less than 12 hours. If you are looking for a 5 star hotel this is definitely NOT the place to stay--an expensive room rate does not equate to a luxurious experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Pantages”
Reviews.Author: Superbad
Reviews.Content: The Pantages Hotel: Toronto, Ontario, Canada Date: August 4, 2006 Reviewer: A frequent traveler Pittsburgh, PA The Pantages hotel was absolutely amazing. The hotel was clean, the service was excellent, and we totally relaxed. We arrived at the hotel during the Caribanna Festival although we wanted to enjoy the festival we wanted to return to relaxation and we did. The Pantages is wonderful contemporary hotel. My Fiance and I loved it. Expect to pay 30 us per day for parking though. We found a lot across the street for a lot less. When we return to Toronto we will definitely return to the Pantages. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have picked a better place!”
Reviews.Author: kimfolz
Reviews.Content: We came to Pantages Hotel to celebrate our 3 year anniversary, and it was perfect. We stayed in the Serenity suite, and it was exactly like the pictures. Internet isn't free. The jacuzzi tub was small and the shower was a bit cramped, but that is the only bad thing I can say about our room. Like the description says on their website, when you get off the elevator, you are greeted with a pleasant scent, not the typcial old smoky hotel stench. The reception desk was friendly and quite helpful (especially with my lost suitcase). We didn't have a car, so we didn't have to worry about parking. But in this location, it isn't worth the trouble of having a car. A metro station is just across the street and a lot of the city is walkable. The diner located downstairs is nicely priced and no frills good. We couldn't have asked for anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: traveljoy24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to travel to Toronto for our 1 year anniversary and we were so excited to try out the Pantages Spa since we had never had massages before we saved up to treat ourselves. We were both very disappointed with our services. I had specifically discussed what we wanted before any services began prior to our visit. If you spend over a certain amount at the spa you are entitled to free water therapies. I specifically wanted this after our massages and instead they forced us to wait almost 1 SOLID hour in some back room that was so boring and far from romantic or calming. Then I was forced to get my manicure and told to come back anytime for our water therapy. We never made it back due to our other trip plans. I felt disrepected and disregarded. I expected to be pampered and treated kindly and we were not. The room was ok but I feel the pictures on their website are misleading. I would NOT EVER recommend the spa. The people that work don't seem to like what they do and they aren't putting their customers first. VERY DISAPPOINTED!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: gerardkelly
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Pantages Suites Hotel and Spa for 7 nights in August. We were both extremely disappointed with this hotel. In fact there is only one good thing about this hotel and that is itâ€™s location. The hotel is within a 2 minute walk to Yonge Street and the excellent Eaton Centre (definitely worth a visit for some great shopping). At check-in the staff member was courteous but not over friendlyâ€¦this seemed to be a common theme during our visit. We always got the impression from the staff that they were not overly interested in assisting you. The reception area is quite small. The hotel bar is adjacent to the reception. The bar is very small and there is no real distinction between it and the hotel reception/lobby. You get the impression that there was not much imagination put into the design/layout of this area. There is no restaurant/breakfast facilities in the hotel but Franâ€™s Diner is part of the hotel building. The food is good here and they serve breakfast. However for an excellent breakfast at good prices check out the Sunset Grill at 1 Richmond Street West (5 minute walk). On entering our room we were very disappointed. We both thought it looked â€˜cheapâ€™. All the rooms/suites have a European Kitchen with cooker, washer etc. Some people might find these facilities useful during their trip but we thought they took away from the overall look of the room. In addition you have to listen to the fridge all night. When you are in the room itâ€™s hard to shake the feeling that you are in a kitchen with a bed in it. The flooring in the room was laminated wood and creaked with every step you took. The bed was just about comfortable. The â€˜400 thread count Egyptian cotton linensâ€™ felt like 400 year old Egyptian linens. The sound/picture quality from the 27 inch flat screen TV was terrible. The bathroom was not much better. The sink was one piece of cheap molded plastic. The flow of water from the shower was also just average. The room also had a mini bar but the prices were outrageous. There were also some snacks available in the room for guests but again they were completely overpriced ($5 for some Lays Chips). Parking in the hotel is again expensive at $30 per night. The Pantages Suites Hotel and Spa is a Boutique Hotel but we both got the impression that this hotel is trying to be something it is not. It looks and feels cheap and is in definite need of a makeover. Toronto is definitely an amazing cityâ€¦well worth a visit. But this wannabe hotel is one to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated And Poor”
Reviews.Author: cakintl
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of all the great reviews we read about it on another travel web site. Boy, were we in for a shock. There is no parking at the hotel and being in downtown parking averages about $30 a day. Nobody tells you that until you get there and now your discounts are long gone. The hotel is old and even though it is renovated, rooms are very dark and way smaller than they show you on the web sites. Not to mention the fact that the building is in old part of downtown and you will be looking into (or somebody will be looking in) adjacent offices and apartments. We did not feel safe while at the hotel and the night staff is not helpfull at all. They charge you for everything extra. Our overall experience was so bad that we cancelled our reservations and moved to another hotel right away. Considering that the average room rate is over $200/night, it is a very BAD DEAL !!

Reviews.Title: “Come with lots of cash”
Reviews.Author: thetraveler31
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a very trendy feel to it. I loved the hardwood floors in the rooms. Nice touch. They even had a CD of soft music playing in the room when we arrived. However, there are extra charges everywhere you turn. Local calls cost $1.44 each. They charge you buy the minute to use their internet, even if you have your own computer. They have all kinds of snack foods such as potato chips and candy bars placed around the room. All of these items have price tags on them. The prices are absolutely insane. $5 for a can of pringles. Yesturday I was at the grocery store and they were 89 cents. These items aren't in any kind of container so I would suggest that you not bring children to this hotel for they will certainly be tempted.They have a CD lying on the counter top that says you are welcome to take it, for $25. What?!? Its a CD of 7 instramental songs or so. The staff is very nice and they are always willing to help. However, they expect to be tipped for it. Now don't get me wrong, I realize tipping is a part of it. But every time I would walk out the door they would rush to open it for me and then want to be tipped. I went out shopping one day and came back with two medium sized bags, they certainly weren't heavy or a burden one of the men at the door absolutley insisted on carrying them up for me, and then of course waited for his tip. I probably spent more in tipping people to do things that quite honestly I'd prefer to do my self than I did on most other things. They also have call girls that live there which quite honestly bothers me. I know I'm a prude...but to me its uneasy to see prostitutes walking about. Also, there was a hustler magazine under our bed when we checked in. I'm sure it was just something that the house keeper missed but just the cover was pretty raw. We did go to the spa and loved it. The people were super nice and it was reasonably priced. I understand that this is a separate business though, ran by different management. They do have a suana and a work out room, but of course you have to pay extra to use them. My boy friend then realized he forgot his tooth brush. Just about every hotel we have been to has cheap toothbrushes that they will give you if you forgot yours. Not this hotel we were told that they were sold in their store (they have conveince type store on the first floor) we go in there and of course there are the cheapy toothbrushes that every other hotel would give you free with a price tag of $6. I ordered breakfast from room service one morning I got a cup of hot chocolate and and pancake and egg meal. The pancake and egg meal was 16$ the hot chocolate was $8 and then there was a $4 room service fee and of course the girl wanted to be tipped. Bottom line everything thing is extra in this hotel. This hotel had a lot of nice features. Eager staff, clean rooms (for the most part) and a realxing atmosphere. However, next time I visit Toronto I will stay with another hotel. They're were so many beautiful hotels, that will hopefully not "nickle and dime" their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Yikes!”
Reviews.Author: hotelio
Reviews.Content: My husband has stayed at the Pantages several times for business travel and was generally pleased. As a result when our family was in Toronto we booked a room there. We were escorted to your room and I was shocked to see that the suite (the largest and supposedly one ot the nicest in the hotel) was dreary and worn with stains all over the carpert and furniture. It was dark and everthing in the suite seemed neglected form the walls that were chipping to the bathroom that needed tile work and plastering There was also what appeared to be a fresh vomit stain that has not been competely cleaned. I tend to be very picky and was sickedned by the thought os staying there so we checked out and were lucky enough to find a room at the Park Hyatt which was wonderful but more than twice as expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Big mistake!”
Reviews.Author: ninjagenie
Reviews.Content: 3 months ago, I decided to plan a 'girls getaway weekend' at the Pantages with 6 of my closest friends, as I am getting married in September. The website looked great, and I had read good reviews when they opened. My friend and I worked to book 2 (adjoining) Ambassador Suites, and 2 spa treatments per person. Arriving on Saturday, and leaving on Sunday, it seemed simple enough, and we booked directly with the hotel, as their website wouldn't accommodate such a complicated request. When we were on our way on Saturday, we called to let them know that border traffic was especially heavy, and what was the policy if we were late. We were informed that there would be no refund, and that all spa services were booked solid so there would be no rescheduling. We were also told that *I* called and cancelled my own 2 appointments. WHAT?! We arrived right as our appointments were scheduled to begin. All of the spa services were nothing special, and a few of the girls complained that their manicures/pedicures were done poorly. One girl even was given a blister due to overzealous filing! Another nail technician spent the whole time lamenting about the other technicians. Very classy. After our appointments were done at 5pm, we were told that only ONE of our rooms was ready. And that they were on two different floors, not adjoining as we had requested. After waiting an additional 2 hours, our 2nd room was *ready* at 7pm. The staff blamed a fire alarm early in the day, in addition to the recent airport security issues as to why our room was delayed. They then offered ONE DRINK at the in-hotel martini bar as compensation. Again..WHAT?! The second room (which we waited forever to get into) was terrible. This Ambassador suite had a ton of damage to it, which I suspect was the reason for the delay. It was missing furniture, wall hangings, a phone, working interior door locks, and working outlets. Though we paid $40 extra *per person* for 4 people to be in the room, it was not prepared that way. We were provided with 2 towels, hardly any tolietries, and no extra pillows for the pullout bed. The hotel services booked was also marked up with black marker, showing that local calls were no longer complimentary. A 30 second call to a restaurant up the block cost us $1.44. Sizewise, it was way too small to be called a suite. After complaining to the front desk several times, we were told the head manager was out of town until this coming Wednesday, and that we should call back then. No room change or credit was offered, as the excuse now was that the AIDS conference was opening that evening, and the hotel was booked solid. We spent $1500 in less than 24 hours, and while booking 3 months in advance, were still treated terribly. This hotel doesn't care about their guests, and isn't interested in providing you with the high quality experience they CHARGE YOU for. There are so many great options in Toronto, don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice bldg, below average service.”
Reviews.Author: Lito_Key
Reviews.Content: The photos of the Pantages indicate luxury rooms, and attention to detail. A stay there proved that if you have a choice of great service or a cool-looking place, then take the hotel with great service. The Pantages is cool-looking, but the service is poor. I should've realized the reputation of the hotel, when I got in the cab at the airport, said Pantages Hotel, and the driver said "never heard of it." The counterpart of that was each time I asked for directions at the front desk, they said "never heard of it." There is no concierge, so you just take your chances that whoever is then at the front desk may be of some help. But, they had no street map, no guide/map for the streetcar system, and didn't know where major tourist attractions were located. My prime gripe was that the promised "suite" is a hotel room. There is no separate sleeping area, it's one room. There too was no pull-out couch, or any place for a rollaway in their "deluxe suite." So, my kid had no where to sleep, and my wife and I expected a suite to have a wall or divider of some sort for our sleeping area. When I tried to get this remedied by the knowledgeable front desk, the first person I spoke to said 'shouldn't be a problem.' I went back to the room, discussed it with my wife, and when I came back to the desk, a new person was on duty. They said 'no way.' I rented a larger room, but the front desk said that my reservation for the so-called "deluxe suite" already had been charged to my credit card, and they were unwilling to refund any of that. My thought was that all three of us would move into the larger room, and give up the smaller "suite." The hotel's idea was to charge me for two rooms, which they did. I will say that the housekeeping staff was excellent, and our rooms always were kept very nice. The location is good, but the parking is not good, and there's precious little space in the lobby. They have no business center, no pool, no coffee shop, and the internet station in the lobby has a keyboard from a ten-cent rummage sale. Just to make my 5 night stay memorable, the A/C quit. When we came back from sightseeing, the room was hot. We called the helpful front desk, and reported the outage. Then, we went out for dinner and some evening activities. When we returned at 11:30, nothing had been done. I called the desk, and asked why no one came to repair it, and they had no idea. They said they'd call back. About 10 minutes later, they called, not to arrange for the repairman to come up, but to offer to move us to another room - at 11:45 p.m.! Packing and moving @ midnight was not a welcome offer, when they'd had the entire evening to have someone fix the problem. Also, twice during our stay, our electronic keys quit working. Sure, they re-coded some new keys for us, but that was after we'd gone up to our room, realized we were locked out, go back to the desk, then come back up with the 'new' keys. When I stay in a luxury hotel or a boutique hotel, esp., on a vacation, I expect excellent service. Many hotels are nice buildings, but for me, it's all about the service. If they don't take good care of me and the family, then that negatively impacts my vacation. I cannot recommend this hotel, since I know there are several other ones in Toronto where you'll be treated better for about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “The one and only place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rosaliek
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel after our return from Montreal after staying at the sister hotel The Cosmopolitan which was outstanding we have decided to try the Pantages. The hotel is on the modern Boutique hotel style where the staff is very personal and inviting. We loved going down in the afternoon for martiniâ€™s in the afternoon and chatting with the bartender Melissa who was lovely. The rooms are very specious and comfortable with all the necessities one would want in a hotel room. And biggest advantage to the hotel is its close proximity to the Eaton center mall and other attractions. We highly recommend staying here you will not want to go to any other hotel in town when you have the Pantages and its location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, Valet needs some work”
Reviews.Author: jenncruz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pantages hotel for one night and held a small get together there. I booked an ambassador suite and it was huge for the price we paid. The living area was bright and very spacious with plenty of seating and sleek furniture-not worn, as previous reviews had mentioned. The bedroom was cozy and the bed was absolutely comfortable. Turn down service at night inlcuded dimming the lights, drawing the curtains and putting on cool jazz music which was a nice touch. Service wasn't bad- one of our lamps didn't work, we needed more towels and more wine glasses. Each time someone showed up very promptly. Our spa appointments the next morning was very relaxing and the people were very friendly. The only downside had been the valet attendant who was rude to us. He never cracked a smile and practically insinuated that we couldn't afford the $30 parking.

Reviews.Title: “Not a relaxing stay!”
Reviews.Author: RichMcG
Reviews.Content: I expected great things from this hotel, and really only got a so-so service. First off, the hotel is located in a great spot - just around the corner from the Eaton Centre and Hudson Bay's HQ. Yonge Street is cleaning up its act, and I certainly felt safe walking around the area at night. However, I found my entire stay to be sterile and charmless. The receptionist seemed to have a very high opinion of herself and a low opinion of us as guests, and certainly didn't get our stay off on the right note. The rooms were well appointed, with comfortable beds and beautiful bathrooms, but I've never in my life seen a more overpriced mini-bar....in fact, it seemed the hotel was constantly trying to take more money out of my pocket. Parking was a steep $35/day, and don't be fooled by the fact this is a 'spa hotel'. In order to use the sauna in the spa, I was charged $17! The spa seems to operate as a very seperate business, so I feel the description is a bit misleading. Other staff we met included the parking valet and the bellhop - again none of them met us with any charm or panache. It felt like we were disturbing them from something else they'd rather be doing....And I'm not being an old fogey re: this - I'm only 32! Breakfast isn't included in the room rate, but the diner on the corner does a good feed of food. If you want to try something eggs-tra special, there is a diner on Yonge St behind the hotle tha specialises in all things eggy....a real treat for brunch! I loved Toronto but was unimpressed by this charmless wanabee hotel. I wouldnt stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, but there are better options”
Reviews.Author: quivondra
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed that the gym was closed when we were there, since I booked the room at Pantages based on that. The diner downstairs is terrible. I don't know how you can mess up eggs, but they managed to do it. The breakfast is pastries, fruit, coffee and juice and was set up at the bar. At night, the bar was nice but there is really no vibe there and the prices are a bit high. After talking to some locals, I was told the area closer to all the restaurants downtown (entertainment district and Queen West Village) have cool hotels and then you can be closer to the nightlife. Being near the Eaton center was nice, but I didn't buy a single thing since we have all those stores in the states. I did most of my shopping on Queen street West at hipper boutique stores that were reasonably priced and a very chic home store like West Elm but a lot better. In any event, this place is fine, but I was expecting a little more luxury and a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average Boutique Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: PKYUEN
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Pantages in June 2006 for 2 nights, It was a very hot and humid day in Toronto and we arrived at the hotel to find no air conditioning in the lobby. We were very dissapointed to find the room so poorly put together with very noticeable worn furniture and accessories, especially the rug by the bed it was a scary looking thing.The room is not like the pictures advertise on the website or as great as the reviews written. The room and bathroom was clean. The bed was very hard and the bedding were less than acceptable for a boutique hotel, we travel a lot for business and pleasure and often stay at boutique hotels for the quality and unique service, this was not the case. We booked a couples massage at the spa and found the price was fair and the attendents were friendly. After the first night sleeping on the uncomfortable bed we decided to check for a room at the Le Germaine even if it meant forfeiting our payment for the 2nd night. Unfortunately there was no vacancy.
