On the day of our check out we had to leave at 6am to catch a flight at the airport to our next destination in the United states, the clerk at the front desk insisted on calling a cab to the airport for us and told us it was a better rate because of the hotel (even though there were cabs across the street from the hotel). What great service we thought and decided to take him up on his offer, and of course when we arrived at the airport we ended up paying $15.00 more than average (no meter running btw). After arriving at our next hotel and after unpacking our suitcases we realized we had left our electric toothbrushes and bath products behind. I called the Pantage and asked if they could mail just the toothbrushes to my home address at my expense, to my dismay I was told housekeeping had no items in the lost and found. I was shocked and ask if they could check again, and I was told the room was already occupied and anyways there policy was to turn in all items into lost and found (Definately not in this case!). I emailed the Pantage management of this experience and only to receive a reply a week later from the head of housekeeping stating they found nothing in the room and they have returned electric toothbrushes to there guests in the past. Yes, we lost two toothbrushes costing $160.00 each and obviously someone needed them more than we did. Also the Pantage management was less than helpful and courteous! I would definately not stay at this below average hotel again, and I highly recommend travelers who expect a comfortable bed in a genuine boutique hotel to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business Meetings”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our company's last general meeting was hosted at the Pantages Hotel in downtown Toronto. The facilites there were great and were able to accomadate our large group. They offered all the latest technology for us to give presentations etc... The catered lunch was great and made it very convenient to eat while continuing to be prodcutive in our meeting. The also had plenty of additional rooms for smaller break-out seesions that we needed to have. The hotel staff was friendly which made our stay even better. The hotel rooms were very comfortable and the hotel made it easy to check in despite our large group. Our company was able to pre-arrange everything with one sales person prior to our stay which made things run much smoother. I along with my peers would recommend the Pantages for any group looking to hold a meeting or host any event. Thanks. JC

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Pantages suites hotel and spa was exceptional. First class from the service to the amazing rooms. It's nice to finally stay in a hotel where the set up makes you feel like you are staying in your own condo and not another generic hotel! Professional staff and warmth makes your stay very appealing. I would definitely come back and recommend it to others.Very impressive establishment.

Reviews.Title: “24 hour service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Friends and I stayed at the Pantages for the weekend and were really pleased with our accomodations. We were celebrating a friend's birthday and with the hotel situated so close to the city's night life it made it easy to get around from place to place and not have far to go once the night ended. After a very late night out, we were all happy to come back to the hotel to find that they offered 24 hour room-service. The hotel staff were great and even offered us a late check-out which was needed after our late night. I'd totally recommend this hotel for any special occasion you might be celebrating.

Reviews.Title: “Service with Style”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the Pantages Hotel in Toronto we were very impressed. As we pulled up in front of the hotel, we were greeted immediately by a valet attendant to park our car and bellman to assist us with our luggage. Both were very courteous and helpful. We then made our way to check-in and again were greeted with a genuine smile and quick service. The staff were very accommodating and made our stay there very enjoyable, helping us with whatever we needed. The lobby of the hotel is chic and modern and the same design esthetic was echoed in the decor of our room, which was clean and bright. The bed was very comfortable and the room was a great space to come and relax in after a long day. It is like a mini retreat in the middle of city. They also have a spa right inside the hotel and a great martini bar in the lobby - which was fun to hang out in before and after our night out on the town. The hotel itself is situated right in the heart of city with every amenity one would need. It is so close to great shopping, restaurants and entertainment as well as the business district. Whether you are coming for business or pleasure, The Pantages is definitely a fantastic place to stay and we would highly recommend it to anyone planning a trip to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, so-so service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Pantages offers all sorts of eye candy, from the gorgeous lobby to the Pottery-Barn-Showroom-like accomodations, but that's where the fun stops. We were ignored when we walked up to the front desk and later found that contrary to what the hotel's site and welcome book say, the Pantages does not offer complimentary wireless intenet access. It's a rate of $12 a day and we wound up being charged for just one day. In short, they seem a bit disorganized. The spa is, at best, OK. I've seen better and there was nothing exciting about this place. What I thought was going to be a $260 couples massage wound up costing me $325, WITHOUT tip. It was only after signing my credit card slip and getting an awkward glance from the massage therapist that I thought to ask if tip was included in the fee...there wasnt even a space provided on the bill for me to leave a tip so I had to ring up my credit card once more. All in all, a nice hotel but there are definitely kinks. I'm really not a stickler for service, I just like a clean place to stay when I travel. Having decided to try something different this time around, though, I was a little disappointed with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “I Would Recommend This Hotel & Spa”
Reviews.Author: G-GIRL3670
Reviews.Content: Stayed easter weekend 2006. Great location in Toronto. The hotel has a nice atmosphere. The hotel staff is very helpful & accommodating. The room & hotel in general was neat & clean. The room has just about anything you could need during your stay (especially if staying in the city for a few days). There were no issues with noise from the hospital neaby nor the city street. The spa is very nice & the staff is very friendly & helpful. I am actually going back this weekend. The hotel is priced accordingly for what is offered. I give it a thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “good starting point to all torontos attractions”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel to Toronto alot and always use this hotel. It is convenient to my office, but I am always impressed the friendly and professional staff, nice rooms and good food. The restaurant always has plenty of fresh fruit and a great selection for breakfast. the close vicinity to the town center and to most of the Toronto attractions, like the theaters the mall the P.A.T.H, the underground train and to business centers make it a good starting point to all visitors I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to be !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The service is great the spa is fantastic and the location is the best money can buy! next time im in toronto Pantages is the place ill be.

Reviews.Title: “Closest New Hotel to Eaton Center”
Reviews.Author: AvidTravellerHKG
Reviews.Content: The Pantages is a new hotel that is really close to the Eaton Center. The Eaton Center is â€˜the shopping mallâ€™ in downtown connected to the PATH system linking office buildings underground. It lies between 2 subway stops: Dundas and Queen. There was a lot said about the hotel service in previous reviews. I think to be fair, the staff performance were satisfactory or good during my stay, for Canadian standards. There is of course room for improvement with regards to customer service there, which often involves a lot of fine tuning and proper training of staff. Security is important. The staff checked whether I was hotel guest whilst I was using the free internet in the lobby. Hotel floors can only be accessed after inserting the hotel room card in the lift, which did not work in the last 2 days of stay. The surrounding streets and the hotel, being right across from Massey Hall and St. Michaelâ€™s Hospital, are well lit; although downtown has a lot of people on the streets still. Toronto is relatively very safe compared to other North American cities. Check-in was quick and smooth; the lobby was hip with seating on both sides of the fireplace. Serenity suites (without the kitchen appliances) were on the 5th floor, closer to the spa I guess. I had 1416, probably quieter the higher up. The regular suites are very well equipped except there was no safe: magazines, daily newspaper, hairdryer, well stocked fridge, microwave, dishwasher, different dishes/bowls, glasses, wineglasses, linen, sink, faux granite kitchen counter with stove, coffee/tea maker, washer/dryer, iron/iron board, 2 bar stools, and some fake apples. Storage was ample. There was for sure enough room to walk around in, with a custom desk/sofa unit close to but not right against the window drapes. The lighting were appropriately positioned. The bed was queen sized, with quality linen and lots of big pillows. The floor was hardwood laminate, but very clean. The suite resembled the build quality in some Toronto Condos. There were some scuff marks on the laminate furniture and walls. But overall, very clean. Being a downtown hotel, there is bound to be some noise from the streets, namely sirens, which is unavoidable in any big city, no matter how well insulated the windows are. There was the expected fridge noise not too far from the bed. The â€˜flatscreenâ€™ (CRT) TV was good sized with all the channels from Rogers Cable. I did try out the in-hotel gym which was quite new and had a view to the east. Other hotels I have considered: the Courtyard Marriott with the new bed, the Sheraton with the renovated rooms and a nice pool, the new Cosmopolitan, the new 1 King Street, and the Cambridge Suites. I would definitely stay at the Pantages again for the location, and the comfortable room. Toronto is a destination full of nice people, whether your visit is for business or pleasure. Come to the Pantages for the location and the unique boutique feel- the Canadian way.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not stay here. Rudest customer service ever.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Pantages hotel on a Friday evening by car. There was no free space to leave our car so we had to double park while we waited about 20 minutes for a valet to come and park our car for us. When we finally checked in, we found our completely filthy. It was covered in dust with bits of debris scattered all over the carpet. The staff was understanding and accomadating at this point and assigned us a new room which was satisfactory. Everything was fine up until the following night when we returned by car to the hotel at around 11:15 pm, and again, there was no valet. This was surprising considering the hotel charges an outrageous 30$ per night for parking. Again, there were cars in the small driveway which left no place to leave the car so while my boyfriend double parked I went inside to talk to the front desk to request someone to come out to park the car. The man at the desk barely loked up and told me the valet goes home at 11 pm. He rudely told me to leave my car where it was and someone would eventually move it. I told him that I was double parked and I was not comfortable leaving the car where it was. He then SNAPPED at me - barking sarcastically "that's why we have a driveway". I couldn't believe how rude it was. When I told him that there were cars occupying all the spaces, he didn't seem to care, and told me to park the car accross the street until someone could come out. This hotel is in a dangerous area of downtown Toronto, and I was not about to leave the car unattended for an undetermined amount of time - he got very annoyed, threw a ticket at me and with a raised voice finally agreed to park my car. He came outside and by this point, there was a free spot in the driveway so my boyfriend had just pulled in. He looked at me and accused me of lying about being double parked! It took all that I had inside of me to keep calm because my blood was boiling. When my boyfriend asked him if there was a problem, he was equally as rude to him. He threw us a card for the general manager and told us to talk to him if we were unhappy. We certainly plan on doing just that, but I'm not sure it will accomplish anything. I travel a great deal for business, and I could honestly say that I have never been treated like this at any hotel. Ever. This ruined our stay. I never write in to post reviews on websites like this, but I felt as if customer service like this should never be experienced by anyone. There were other staff who were very friendly and helpful. It is a real shame that the behavior of one person (compounded with the hotel's parking policy) could erase the hard work of the other hard working staff members.

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be deceiving”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at the Pantages Hotel and enjoyed the location. That is the best part. I agree with a previous review that the fixtures, furniture and amenities in general are poor quality. Wear and tear are noticeable. The worst part of the experience was the quality of the bedding. After a great night out with friends, we were underwhelmed by the hard pillows, heavy comforter and scratchy sheets. I have stayed at many hotels and believe the bed is the most important feature. Not at this hotel. The staff worked hard to meet our needs. I hate to be so negative, but...the key cards did not work most of the time...Did not go to the spa due to the poor quality of the rest of the hotel. Design is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a former Torontonian, I've had an opportunity to stay at various hotels in the city centre area. The new Pantages hotel by fax exceeds expectations every time. The bellmen remember you and welcom you back. The rooms are spacious with no details overlooked. The beds are so comfortable and have a featherbed for added luxury, I was actually looking forward to going to bed every night! Room service was timely. I love the spa which is so relaxing and the area is fantastic if you enjoy shopping and very good restaurants in a trendy central area. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “A Hip & Serene Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linny15
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Pantages for 3 nights. I was attending at conference at Marriott Eaton Centre but chose to stay at this hotel based on previous positive reviews. We're so glad we did! The Marriott is lovely but Pantages is really special. As previous reviewers have mentioned, the attention to details is wonderful. The decor is hip and contemporary yet warm and soothing. Retro furnishings, black and white photography, frames of bubbling water, soft lighting, wood and Zen touches define the lobby and hallways. A cozy nook in the lobby, with fireplace, is a great place to have an evening cocktail. We really enjoyed the restaurant, Fran's, which offered a varied comfort food menu as opposed to the more formal offerings at bigger hotels (many great restaurants just a stroll away on Elm Street). The staff in the restaurant and hotel were very friendly and efficient. Andy was very knowledgable and helpful with restaurant selections. The lobby also offers a mini-market that is stocked with great little nibbles, including an ice-cream freezer. We stayed on the Serenity Floor which was perfect for us. We did not require the "suite" amenities. We really appreciated the cleanliness of hardwood (laminate, actually) floors vs. dusty carpet. The room offered an air purifier, a large vase of tall twigs with a lit, quartz water fountain at their base(great night light), super comfy bedding, TV tucked into an armoire, CD player, separate shower and hydro-tub, beautiful Asian style sink, dimmer lights, wonderfully scented bath products, fluffy towels...it just goes on and on. We liked the unique touch of placing semi-precious stones on our pillows instead of chocolates (bought our own Cadbury's in the mini-market). The robes were thick and warm, something I really appreciated when I came down with a cold during our stay. The Serenity Floor hallways were scented with good quality aromatherapy fragrance...very light and pleasant. I also took advantage of the beautiful spa and enjoyed a great massage. Our room also included full or continental breakfast at Fran's. The full breakfast selection was fine but the continental breakfast offered, among other naughty pastries, an amazing apple streudel. The hotel's location is very convenient though the block it faces is somewhat glum. We were not disturbed by city noise, including the hospital located across the street. It was a wonderful stay in everyway!

Reviews.Title: “Understaffed, Poorly Managed, Cheap fixtures, Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having had the chance to stay at many hotels worldwide for business and leisure, I expected so much more from the Pantages Hotel. This hotel opened in April 2005 with a very inexperienced team of staff to run it. The Pantages calls itslef a "boutique hotel" and at first glance it is a cool spot. However once one settles in - it becomes apparent that corners were cut at every opportunity with it's cheap bathroom fixtures, hollow doors, low quality laminate flooring, shoddy messy construction and (while a kitchen in your room can be a good idea) the Goldstar microwave, Citizen TV and Danby fridge are bottom of the line. This hotel has obviously not thought through the needs of the traveller and only concentrated on attempting a NYC boutique feel. A phone, but only on the desk far from the bed - inconvenient for wake up calls. No clock radio so you have to rely on hotel wake up calls which are not reliable at all. Dark, jumpy elevators which scratchy repetitive music - same sound track on repeat every hour it seems. Most frustrating were the Sales Staff who were unproffesional, rude & unaccommodating with almost every request. Double booking rooms, inadequate knowledge of group functions and very poor customer service will keep me from referring or bringing back business - with work or or for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Best So Far”
Reviews.Author: notsohappy12
Reviews.Content: This lovely boutique hotel in Toronto was everything I expected and more. The service was absolutely wonderful from the valet, to Melissa on the front desk. We had a suite which had all the amenities you needed. The bed was perfect and the fact that the windows opened was really nice. The ambiance is serene and upscale. We had massages in the spa where we were treated like a King & Queen. This is the third boutique hotel we have stayed in in Toronto, also South Beach and by FAR the best! The little restaurant is not too trendy and overpriced. The price is amazingly good, especially for the Romantic Retreat pkg. we had. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: DT8
Reviews.Content: After reading rave reviews for this hotel I was considerably disappointed once I arrived. The first issue was hot water, or lack of it, and after asking four times for it to be fixed I was finally moved to another room (albeit better), where there was no bath plug (something which took another three days and numerous mentions to fix). If you order food it comes from the adjacent cafe, and is served in plastic cartons and is often not warm. Plus the hotel is already feeling a bit run down - the corridors are already in a state of disrepair. I don't think there's enough staff to go around in general. Considering the cost I think this hotel requires a serious management overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Good location - Good price!”
Reviews.Author: Phillipt21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned today from a five night stay at the Pantages in Toronto. As usual, the reviews on TripAdvisor were spot on. So, let me give you the good bits: * Good location - not in the entertainment district - but after exploring this area found it rather seedy anyhow. The location of the hotel was just right. The eaton centre was just across the road; bars across the road; theatres next door etc. Really just right. * Great Hotel - this really is a boutique hotel (even though some reviewers seem not to agree). The price was super (booked via Expedia and paid Â£60 per night). The amenities were superb - great gym; extensive tv and film selection; nice comfy bed; nice bathroom; everything in the room (and I mean everything! e.g. from chopping board to iron to CD player to dishwasher to dish cloths to washer/dryer!! - everything!). Free internet in the lobby was a real plus and really didn't need to be provided. * Breakfast is included - we took the cooked breakfast at Fran's next door (they have an agreement with the hotel so that the breakfast is provided free to guests). However - my goodness, I've never seen so many miserable waiters/waitresses in my life. When they knew we were from the hotel, they just couldn't be bothered and the service was awful. Not sure why as the guests tip them - having said that, I tipped every day and that is probably my biggest regret! BUT - nice to have a great breakfast in the deal. All in all, I'd certainly stay there again. It was a differently nice hotel, certainly better than a stuffy old Toronto 5 star hotel. (oh and by the way - didn't hear much at all from the hospital - I think some people have sensitive earing. The key point is this - if you needed the hotel, couldn't think of a better location! - but if you are going to go and sleep in a big city (and anyone who's been to New York/London/Paris will understand)....there are sirens!!!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique, Elegant Spa Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Explorator
Reviews.Content: If I had to use one word to describe this hotel it would either be relaxing or chic. The rooms are very big, comfortable, clean, tastefully appointed with modern furniture and accents. To our surprise, the rooms were incredibly quiet. Service was incredible, with the front desk answering promptly and effectively to any requests. We made use of the spa for a massage and found it to be an oasis of peace. The meditation channel, spa, and crystals placed on your bed gave it a gentle new age twist which we enjoyed. If you stay here, you are blocks away from the metro which is clean, easy to use and safe. The hotel is conveniently located close to shops, restaurants, and cafes. Overall, we give the Pantages four thumbs up and would certainly return as well as recommend it to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Above average, but could use some improvement”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A hotel with a lot of pluses and some minuses. On one major point, though, I think other reviewers have been overly harsh. The room we were given is in the Serenity Suite and is across the street from a downtown hospital, St. Michael's. But the two nights we were there, we didn't hear a single siren. Indeed, we didn't even hear all that much street noise, which is amazing, considering that Shuter is a fairly busy downtown side street. PLUSES Extraordinarily comfortable (and spacious) bed, probably one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in at a hotel. Big plus. Also nice to have other furnishings -- not just a bed and a desk and a nightstand. There was a chaise longue-type chair on one side of the room and a sofa-type piece set into the desk unit by the window. Terrific location (in the south-central part of downtown near Elgin & Winter Garden Theatre, Eaton Centre, and Dundas Square, and right across the street from Massey Hall), just a block walk from the Queen Street metro station. Extensive cable TV channel selection. Not the largest bathtub in the world, but the water pressure was right and the water temperature was always hot, which was a huge plus. As mentioned above, relative lack of street noise for such a central urban location. MINUSES Harried (seemingly understaffed) and sometimes sloppy desk service -- they are more than somewhat scattered and, although they are apologetic for their lapses, it's irritating to arrive at the hotel to check in after a long day to discover that the front desk is claiming that your reservation was cancelled. Parking when you first arrive is a confusing ritual. There is no clear signage on the front of the building indicating where parking is supposed to occur. The parking is done by valet but that is not evident from either signage or activity outside the building (unless you happen to see a valet actually moving a vehicle). The street is quite busy until after 10pm and it's not a simple procedure to pull to the curb and run inside to ask for the valet. A stack of goodies sitting on top of the fridge and inside that look tempting but are all sealed and come with a hefty price tag -- $4.95 Canadian for a bottle of Coke that you could get for $2 from a vending machine is ridiculous (and that's just one example). No glasses in the room anywhere (except a couple of decorative glasses sitting on a shelf as part of the desk unit), and the front desk seemed mystified by our request for a bucket of ice. Shower was very roomy and sleek, but the water took five minutes to heat up. All in all, the room was handsome and impressive, but in terms of conveniences versus appearance, the hotel is weighted too far toward the latter at the cost of the former. It's nice to have hardwood floors and bubbling fountains inside bamboo floral settings, but it's nicer to have efficient room service and some of the basic amenities that you would find in a Motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: RetiredGrandma08
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Rochester on the ferry early at 12 noon - they had a room ready so we could immediately check in (check-in is usually 3:00 PM). Rooms are beautifully equipped with complete kitchen, including washer & dryer if you need one -very serene atmosphere even in the elevators - We did not hear any sirens from the hospital at night and slept better than ever in very comfortable beds - a continental breakfast is included in your stay and it was delicious and is served from 7-11AM - we stopped at the Spa at the hotel before we left and the staff took us on a complete tour of all their facilities - next time we definitely want to book some spa services - on the web site for the hotel you will find a complete listing and prices for all the spa services - we were leaving on the ferry to go home but we didn't need to leave the hotel until 5:30 PM - they kept our luggage for us in a separate room as we had to check out by 11:00 and actually they offered us a later check out at 12:30 if that would help us - they called a taxi for us to get to the ferry which was there in 5 minutes -

Reviews.Title: “Nothing boutique about it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Many of my complaints have been already voiced about this hotel, may I stress again however the annoyance of emergency vehicle sirens all night long going to the hospital across the street. Im not sure if its the diner the hotel has in it, or the hotel itself, but this place attracts some very questionable clientele. I was asked if i wanted to buy a certain weed on my way to my room once in the elevator, and my son saw someone laying in the lobby bathroom one morning after breakfast. the service wasn't anything to write home about either. the front desk seemed understaffed because at every encounter you would wait at least 5 or 10 minutes in line before you were served. they seemed very stressed and over worked. You can't maintain that boutique feel, and high level of service if the staff are stressed. If you like a good nights sleep, and want to receive real service, stay elsewhere, especially away from that hospital.

Reviews.Title: “a fresh scent of ocean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: a friend of mine suggested, when you go to toronto stay at the "serenity floor" in the pantages. back then i didnt quite understood what he was talking about, but after ariiving and registering "serenity" to me i found out that i am totally in love with a fresh smell of ocean and in zen point of view.

Reviews.Title: “the pantages is a cool place to live in”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i write this hoping to visit the pantages again and soon. this place is remarkable so different and yet not a vacant moment but every second is filled with new delights and superb colture. if you dont understand me you just have to cheack it fo your self. by the way great beds and exclusivley happy faces give you service with big smiles.

Reviews.Title: “great service and unique atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i visited the pantages earlier this month, and was surprised to see the unique style and atmosphere, a cool breeze of be-bop air and marmalade skies. i really think artists and romantics will find joyfull moments here i know i did. did i say the service is exellent.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation & Serenity Rules”
Reviews.Author: kickerAuburnNy
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at Pantages (July 18-22, 05); it was probably the most relaxing hotel I've ever stayed in. Beautiful accomodations. My room had a queen bed, full kitchen, washer & dryer. Fridge is loaded (honor system), but still has plenty of room if you buy your own food & drinks. Bathroom is on small side, but well planned with a deep tub, and there's a separate area outside the bath for putting on make-up, hair brushing, etc.. It was 90 degrees all week; I sweated through several outfits and the room washer/dryer came in unexpectedly handy. Continental breakfast was sufficient: coffee, juice, pastries. Small bar (typically hotel pricey) with a beautiful and enjoyable bartender, Yanna, who makes a great martini; her pleasant conversation will help you forget the price of the drinks. Attached Fran's Restaurant was useful; good food, good prices. Location: one block from Eaton Centre with all the stores & restaurtants you could need; also in the middle of several small theatres. Hospital down the street, but I was never awakened by sirens or noise. Only negative is lack of pool. However, this can be looked at as a positive for business travellers or singles & couples who don't want a hotel overrun with kids (it's a great place even with kids if they don't mind no pool. Staff was overly polite & friendly. I would recommend Pantages to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “never fails to be great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another trip staying at the Pantages ounce more. Great job guys you never fail to produce hospitality. See you next time again

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Keevin
Reviews.Content: Stayed there July 14-17, 2005. This is a great hotel. We stayed on the Serenity Floor, in room 404. Room was very clean. Had separate whirl pool tub ans shower. Room is well appointed and had a king size bed. There was a little less floor space due to its size. I was first to use Yoga mat ( it was still in wrapper), I had to use it because the health club was closed for some repairs. They did offer to send me to Bally's which was a half a block and I went but wal already a member anyway. The staff is cordial and efficient. I did not use the spa, almost did but went with wife for a day walk instead. Seemed nice, prices higher on weekend for services. PARKING IS 30CDN A NIGHT WITH IN AND OUT. The included Breakfast is either a juice and coffe and pastry in lobby or full breakfast next door in restuarant. Both are great. This hotel is very close to East Centre and convenient to everything. WARNING DRINK AT LOBBY BAR IS WAY OVERPRICED. HOTEL DOES NOT CONTROL BAR AND THEY SAID THEY GET A LOT OF COMPLAINTS.

Reviews.Title: “Pantages: Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: eqmike
Reviews.Content: Glad to see some good reviews recently for Pantages. I stayed two weeks ago for 3 nights in a Master Suite with my wife and 2 year old. We had a great stay - lovely room, superb service - what more could you want?! Front desk staff were very hepful, room was cleaned & turned down daily, and they arranged friendly & reliable airport transfers for me. I didnt have any noise problems at all. Fran's Diner is great for breakfast & other meals, and they really made an effort to look after my mischevious son!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An exceptionally immaculate, lovely, and gracious retreat! We loved the perfect location near the eiton center downtown Toronto!,, warm welcome and the superb manner. Absolutely perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel to anyone”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pantages Hotel in downtown Toronto on Saturday April 12, 2005. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. All the staff we dealt with were very pleasant. Room was good size. King size. Room was well maintained as did the corridors. Renovations continue in the Easy walking access to everything in downtown Toronto, Eaton's Centre and some major theaters are only few minutes walk form the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “1502 Beautiful !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had tickets to a concert Jun 12 so we thought we'd make a night of it. I got online and started looking for a hotel through tripadvisor website. I came across the Pantages website looked around (great site by the way) and called reservations..I booked a room for Jun 12... From the moment we arrived at you door we knew we had chosen well... The staff is outstanding!!! Very courteous and helpful on all shifts. From the valet to the desk clerk to the cleaning staff, again we cannot say enough about the staff !!! Norah-Lynn took advantage of the spa while I relaxed and read a book in our room...The room we can't say enough !!! 1502 Beautiful, not what one expects a hotel room to be. From the hardwood floors to the furniture to the bathroom... Well Done !! Your lobby is elegant and the elevator and halls are refreshingly unique. Again thank you and your staff for a job well done as well thank you for having such a unique hotel that we're positive one day soon will be a gem in the city of Toronto's hotel community!! We'll be back to try it out!!! Paul & Norah-Lynn Bradford, ON **

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room & the goodies!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Pantages the last 5 trips to Toronto- I love the comfort of the room- Love the pillows, sheets, bed and love the fridge & goodies they put there for the weary traveller- Great Job! I have told my friends -My only value add- Is change the person at the bar! Reception & valet are great people-quiet hotel for a down town establishment- lots of great restaurants inthe area- Frans is great breakfast & lunch!- All in all we will continue to go there! Thank you people at the Pantages!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel snob...and I loved it.”
Reviews.Author: MarkIndpls
Reviews.Content: I collect hotel stays as a hobby and was a bit concerned about staying at Pantages due to some terrible reviews on this site. I have stayed in everything from Ian Schraeger's group of hotels to the Ritz in Maui...the Old Cataract in Egypt to the Icehotel in Northern Sweden. While Pantages in not exactly the ubertrendy Delano type hotel it may seem at first to be trying to emulate, it IS a nicely styled hotel with large rooms, nicely designed public and private space and decent service. For the price and location it is a deal! Don't get me wrong, Pantages is not a boutique hotel (the small details are missing)...but the overall impression and value make it worth a stay again next time I'm in Toronto. The Spa is first class. My partner had a facial which he would give a "B" and I had a pedicure which was top-notch. The breakfast was sugar...not nice...but 24 hour room service was a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly built and designed... trying to pull off something more!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the loudest hotel I have ever stayed in. The walls are paper thin and the emergency ward across the way is so loud! The rooms near the elevator have the added bonus of the incredibly loud double ding every time the elevator goes to that floor all night long. The service at the hotel is also very poor. They gave away the room we requested and put us in a much smaller room. We ordered room service and it never came. The staff was very unapologetic when we called to find out that the order had never been brought to the kitchen. The only thing boutique-like about this hotel is the small size of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Serenity suits rock!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Toronto where I spent 3 days at the Pantages hotel - what a jam!!! I was welcomed by a very freindly stuff that offered me upgrade to a serenity one bedroom suit at the serenity suits floor. I was amazed to find out how large was the suit that I got (I beleive it was larger than 700 sq !!). The green lighting in the main corridor and the water fountains create a spectacular atmosphere and relaxed me at once. The suit is stuning : totally new, fresh. contemporary but yet very cozy. I had in suit fountain which creates an amazing dance of lights on the nearby wall. The king size bed was beautiful and extremely comfortable, the 2 bathrooms are equipped with hot tub jaccuzzi, separate shower with glass walls and a beautiful zen vanity. The hotel is very well located just nearby the Eaton centre in downtown Toronto. I had a great stay in Toronto. I enjoyed touring the city, the shopping, the night life and my stay in the Pantages. No doubt next time Ill be in Toronto Ill know exactly where Im going to stay. Looking forward to visiting again, love Toronto!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend in Toronto. Pantages is in a great location, a couple minute walk from Eaton Centre and a bunch of theaters. We stayed in the regular suite, it comes with a fully equipped kitchen and it even has a mini dishwasher! Hardwood (Laminate) floors are a definite plus for those who don't like carpet. Great for those who are there on extended business stays, they offer complimentary wireless internet access and it is quite easy to access as long as you have a wireless card on your laptop. They offer 24 hour valet service and there is a restaurant in the hotel that is also open 24 hours. Within walking distance to many local area attractions. Very easy to get to if you are flying into Pearson. Has a full service spa on the 5th floor that is open from 9am to 10pm weekdays. I would definitely stay here again next time I am in town. Staff was also helpful and friendly which is also very important.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful and relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: AgentSusan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pantages for one night to attend a concert at Massey Hall which is RIGHT across the street - we could see the concert hall from our window - this was SO convenient. We were upgraded from the Deluxe room we booked to a Serenity suite - room 401 - gorgeous and very large corner room with windows on 2 sides, comfy king size bed, hardwood floors, tv, small fridge and relaxing fountain. The decor was lovely. The bathroom had a whirlpool tub and separate shower - nice towels and bathrobes. The front desk staff and valet parking staff were friendly and accommodating - whenever we got off the elevator and came into the lobby we were greeted with a friendly good morning,afternoon or evening. You have a choice of complimentary continental breakfast in the lobby bar or a complimentary full hot breakfast next door at Fran's. We chose the hot meal and it was tasty and plentiful and the service was good. Make sure you ask for a room with a view as there is another building right next door which would make for a poor view on the lower floors of that side. Yes we heard a couple of sirens and some traffic but this is a big city so what else can you expect. We would definately stay here again - check out the great CAA/AAA discounts if you are a member-feel free to e-mail me if you have any questions

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pantages Suites”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's always a big decision on where to stay in Toronto since there are so many great hotels. Since we were going to the Canon Theatre we decided on Pantages for location. What an excellent choice - the hotel was very glamourous - it really made us feel special. We were able to check in early, have a later check out and the staff was great. The convenience of having the suite was great. We were in and out lots and the location was excellent. I can't wait to go back to Toronto and stay again! I am telling all my family and friends to choose Pantages on their next visit.

Reviews.Title: “A greatlittle secret”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Toronto where I was Recommended by my friend to stay at the Pantages Hotel just steps away from the eaton center. I was delighted by this beautiful friendly hotel everything is so stark and clean giving you the feeling of a true boutique hotel. It is nice to have a choice of breakfast between the lobby bar continental or the adjacent restaurant. Rooms are large and fitted with all the equipment one can need at a stay in a hotel. and not to mention having a spa just floors below you makes it even more delightful. Will stay there on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel???? HA!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to say, this hotel is THE worst hotel I've ever stayed in. The room was certainly not up to standard to a luxury hotel and the fixtures in the room were attached half-assed. I even noticed plaster on the tiles in the shower. The so-called hardwood floors were scuffy looking and the towels were like the ones found at a cheap hotel. Also, being across the street from a busy hospital didn't help either. There was so much noise at night that I kept waking up. Hardley a relaxing get-away. I don't know how these people are writing reviews that praise the hotel. Sounds to me that they work for the hotel. Don't waste your time with this so called luxury hotel. Stay somewhere nicer!

Reviews.Title: “Huge room”
Reviews.Author: artslover
Reviews.Content: Our experience was quite unlike some other reviewers. We booked a regular guest room. It turned out to be huge. Not only was there a sizable sitting area, the room included a kitchenette. The bathroom was rather small with virtually no counter space although there was a tall narrow shelf to use in lieu of the counter. The room was very quiet. The bed very comfortable with very good quality sheets. There were lots of nice touches like turn down service with the radio CD player turned on in the evenings. The street at the front is not commercial. As others have noted, there is a hospital across the road, but it is around the block from busy Yonge street and the huge downtown shopping mall. I found the street at night to be very safe when I walked from the hotel to an opera a few blocks away on Yonge street. I cannot recommend the restaurant although it was adequate for breakfast. The bar in the reception area looked busy every evening. At the time we stayed, there was no liquor licence for the rooms so the mini bars were stocked with non-alcoholic beverages. We were told this would soon change. The exercise facilities were not extensive but had all the basics and use was complimentary. There was also free internet access in a room off the reception area. It only had one computer but since I had no real need to bring my laptop (which I could have connected in the room), it was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: During my visit in Ontario , I had to stay 4 nights in Downtown Toronto. The Pantages Suites Hotel made all the different. Good room with large bed and excellent spa. Very clean and excellent service. I should be back in Ontario within 6 months and I will be back at the Pantages Suites Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best - I couldn't ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Am I in NYC? WOW, What a beautiful hotel, Friendly staff, Amazing King size bed and cotton linen. We are new in Toronto, Canada. We came a year ago and after a very busy year, my husband surprised me with a long weekend at the Pantages Suites Hotel. We had several massage treatment done by professional therapists. The Spa is beautiful. It was the best weekend in the best hotel I could ask for. We will definitely going to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It looks nice, but that's all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks nice, but that is all it has going for it. The rooms are small, and are advertised as being tranquil and rejuvenating yet the sound of construction blares on for hours a day. Our room didn't have an iron or ironing board, and the continental breakfast couldn't feed a bird! All in all, this hotel was disapointing. It was close to Yonge Street, but located on a dark side street near a couple hospitals and home to some scary individuals, stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved the Pantages. The staff was very friendly and the general ambiance of the hotel is very nice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great spa (Couples Massage)”
Reviews.Author: Canadians-7
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a couples massage at the pantages spa and was rather concerned since I had read some not so positive reviews. We had a wonderful time. The massage treatment was relaxing and the therapists were professional. The fruit platter at the end was a nice touch. We would do it again! We both receive massages on a pretty regular basis and have nothing negative to say about our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Abysmal”
Reviews.Author: MMMNV
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 nights in a Serenity room at the Pantages this weekend (on the Serenity floor). This was to be a "getaway" weekend for me and my fiancÃ©e. I had read some good reviews on the spa and hotel, and thought- let's give it a try. It was a terrible experience. The biggest problem with the Pantages is that they have great ideas, but are unable to implement with class and consistency. The Serenity Room, which is more expensive that the regular rooms, is not only smaller, but missing most of the "amenities" that are standard in the other rooms. Our bathroom had 7 lights, 3 of them missing the covers, so the room was turned into a bright, harsh, sterile white room when the lights where on. There was no dimmer. I actually took out some of the light bulbs. Taking a bath in the Jacuzzi tub was not relaxing, unless all lights were off. The WORST part of the hotel was this- Saturday morning we are awakened at 8:00 a.m. to the sound of hammering. It went on and on and onâ€¦ Horrible way to wake up. Especially in a room we paid more for and was touted for it quiet atmosphere. That night we tried to change rooms. The woman at the front desk told us wasnâ€™t sure if there would be construction the next morning, but there might be. We could switch rooms/floors. I talked to my fiancÃ©e about it, and we went back to the front desk to get the new room. The woman was gone, and the man there said, No, we have an emergency going on (flooding), so we canâ€™t move you. I pointed out that the woman said we could and we did NOT want to wake up to construction (not related to the flooding on one floor). He became irritated with me and told me he would call our room if he could do it. No call. Lo and Beholdâ€¦7:00 a.m. Sunday the drilling starts!!! I call downstairs- and the front desk says- sorry, it was scheduled! We packed up immediately to leave. At the front desk, we said it was unacceptable to have construction going on that affects of all floors, a floor that is all about peace and quiet! Not only that, we were never told upon check-in that this would be happening. The Director of Finance came out to talk to us- I wanted a refund. She said we had to understand that they had an event on the floor below us the next day, so they had to get it ready. What? I HAVE to understand??? I said, you never gave us the option of not staying on that floor, you never informed us. She offered the following: Attempt 1: a discount on another stay or $100 off. I told her that was a joke. Attempt 2: 50% off. ONE NIGHT I told her that was unacceptable Attempt 3: 50% both nights. Still not ideal, but I was tired of this at that point. We left and will not go back. I did not mention to her that we used the hotel for work travelersâ€¦I wanted her to do the â€œrightâ€� thing without pulling that out. Well, guess what... by not making the effort to fix the problem and writing off $460, instead of $230, they lost at least $4000 in revenue from future stays with our company. That said- the Pantages Spa was great.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the service?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well... first off there is a big difference between standard service and friendly service. This place needs needs to focus on the latter; unless you are one of those customers that enjoys hearing "next" when your finished at the front desk. The rooms are small and are probably the left over rooms that the condo developer could not sell (this is a condo highrise aswell). Like another users wrote, this place is a cheap imitation of a boutique hotel. Bottom line is... STAY AWAY. If you want friendly service and a half-decent product, I can guarantee that anywhere else would be better.

Reviews.Title: “Decor is very nice”
Reviews.Author: Audrey73Toronto
Reviews.Content: The decor is very nice - nothing beyond what most boutique hotels offer - I only wish that the service would match it in some way. There was no fridge in the room so no chance of keeping things cool. There were no glasses to have a drink in the room and when I phone housekeeping they couldn't understand what I was asking for and brought wine glasses to have cocktails in and speaking of cocktails the bar in the lobby was a joke - the gal had no idea of how to mix a cocktail. I will say that the small areas in the bar were a very nice innovation. To crown matters when morning came there was not even warm water for a shower, the boiler had shut down in the night!!! This would all be fine in a cheap motel but not the kind of prices that this boutique inn charges.

Reviews.Title: “Boo-Hiss”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Much of what I wanted to say about this hotel was already said, so I'll spare everyone reading this the re-run. I will add however that the hotel is right next to a hospital, and VERY often during the evening and night sirens from ambulances rushing to the emergency room could be heard! My wife and I also can't stress enough the quality of the breakfast. It wouldn't quench the hunger of a field mouse, so unless you want a breakfast appetizer, before paying and ordering something else, just go elsewhere. Nicely decorated, but can't judge this book by its cover. And a stone is a TERRIBLE form of compensation, regardless of its composition! Forget about this place; no way this is boutique.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms & Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gabe05
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this hotel in the larger suites on the 17th floor and had a great view of the city, the rooms are very modern looking as well. Staff was helpful i had no problems with them like other users had and the doormen always open the door to my limo. I passed on the Continental breakfast and had a great BIG breakfast in the diner next door called Fran's i would stay here again since its' such a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Service stinks”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Pantages and the hotel is very beautiful, but the service was horrendous! A previous reviewer said something about the Front Desk agent blaming their poor reviews on management at other hotels... but I doubt it. The service at this hotel really is poor. The Front Desk agents don't make you feel welcome or appreciated and the chambermaids are slow and make you feel as though you are in their way. I've stayed at hotels for far less money and received far superior service. Continental breakfast was horrible, it mas a meal fit for a mouse! Very small, and in some rinky-dink diner next door. I won't even get into the service from our waitress.

Reviews.Title: “No heat!”
Reviews.Author: nesh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were very excited about our stay in toronto at a plush hotel like pantages, we heard that it was a very modern style five star hotel were your stay is guaranteed to be comfortable. First we booked, a zen room cos we thought we would like it as we wanted a nice relaxing getaway but unfortunatly the room was very small and did not have a fridge or anything to keep drinks cool, however the zen room was nicely decorated and the bathroom was really plush and it included a bath and a separate shower unit, but it just wasn't what we want for that weekend. My wife loved the throw that came with the zen room but we later found the same one in pier 1 imports across the street from the hotel .... which is one good thing about the hotel, LOCATION is perfect! we loved the fact that the eaton centre was a quartz stone's throw away. So anyway, we called the concirege to ask for the room to be changed, after waiting 20 minutes someone decided to come up to show us our new room and kindly gave us the ambassodor suite as complimentary. Cool! two tvs, laundry facilities, dishwasher, full fridge/freezer, cooker, kitchen sets, separate lounge and bedroom .... overall excellent hotel room layout especially for a frequent business traveller or family or two couples to stay in. So we entered the suite and it was freezing, we were reassured that it would warm up, but for the whole two days we were there the thermometer persisted to stay below 16 degrees and the heater would turn it self off after 10 minutes in operation after being reset. The first morning was hell because we woke up and the temperature was below 10 degrees in the room ... we were not satisfied with the resolution to this issue as everytime we would call they only response was it will heat up after reset ! and on top of being frustrated about catching a cold someone was kind enough to knock on our door and give us a small quartz stone the size of my toe to help relax us ... yes a stone. The restaurant downstairs is not overpriced and is really good too and cater for a variety or tastes. but dont rely on the complimentary breakfast to fill your hunger in the morning. Overall a bad experience, we had a good time as we didnt let the lack of life support facilities ruin our weekend, but the hotel really need to fix some things up and pay more attention to giving better service. Location is really good and the suite is a good layout. I had no problem with credit card charges like the other review.

Reviews.Title: “Pandora at the Pantages”
Reviews.Author: Maana
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews here, my fiance and I decided to be optimistic and stay at the Pantages anyway, we liked the idea of the boutique style the hotel offered. Upon arrival, we were promptly checked in and even offered an upgrade to a Serenity Suite which we turned down as we wanted the view on the 16th floor instead. We received a room with no kitchen and a queen sized bed. Is this still considered a suite? It had been a long drive to Toronto so I had to make a run to the bathroom, and having stayed at many upscale hotels, I was interested to find that there was no toilet paper holder in the bathroom, the roll was simply placed on top of the toilet...it still baffles me, how much do those things cost anyways? Another thing that bothered me was that there was no complimentary bottled water in the room, I have always thought this to be standard in a five-star hotel, I assumed wrong again! The hotel is in a fabulous location, basically across the street from the Eaton Centre, which was great as the weather was horrible while we were there. In the evening, we went back to the hotel in hopes of ordering a movie on pay-per-view, however, we found that this did not work and called the front desk to come have it fixed. Someone came up promptly to assist us however, could not fix the problem and assured us that tech-support would fix it for us....we never received a phone call back. I have to say, after a cold day with terrible driving conditions, the bed was a nice touch, very comfy!! However, I woke up in the middle of the night, freezing, thinking that my boyfriend had turned off the heating; however, we later figured that the heating in the room was not working. We had set a wake up call for 9 am and woke up discovering that the wake up call had not been made. We were also amused to discover that none of the lights, or the tv, or phone were working in the room due to the power outage in downtown Toronto this past weekend. While they were kind enough to slip our bill under our door, how much more effort would it have taken to wake us up too? The staff was not very accommodating during this time and continually told us there was nothing they could do. We were assured that the manager would be contacting us. No word yetï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotel experiences I've ever had. I booked with the hotel, and 2 weeks prior to arriving my credit card was already charged, but it wasn't a pre-paid reservation. Got that sorted out. Checked in, got the wrong type of room, sorted that out with the front desk. Checked-out, had erroneous charges on my bill (I don't own a laptap and yet mysteriously I was charged for internet?). Went to the continental breakfast which was a joke. Its located in a diner adjacent to the lobby where the selection was rediculous and the service was worse! My biggest complaint is with the service. No one at this hotel seems to smile, and it's very noticeable! I will not return to this hotel, if I wanted to be treated as I was during my stay, I'll go to a government office!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE OF CREDIT CARD CHARGES”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The pantages hotel is very modernized which was a plus when comparing it to all the older hotels that are down town. But this hotel is in need of some new staff I didnt meet one staff member who actually helped us out or was even the slightest bit freindly. Actually when I arrived at the hotel the three girls at the front desk were ignoring me while gossiping about another female on staff. I waited about five minutes for them to stop yacking. I was checking my credit card statment and realized that after being charged for the room the hotel went into my credit card 5 DAYS LATER and added extra charges I called the hotel and asked what the extra charges were for? I found out it was for the mini bar. WE DIDNT HAVE ANYTHING FROM THE MINI BAR. The rude front desk manager told me it was a mistake and that they would reverse the charges. Two days later charges are still on the card only this time I noticed another $40 was taken off. So once again I called the hotel only to find out they are accusing my fiance and I of stealing a pillow. So once again I must deal with the front desk manager who tells me he will look into it. A week later I still have not received a phone call but the charges were reversed on my card. Gee I guess it was just another mistake, nice of them to call and apologize.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, marvelous accomodations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was treated like a crown prince. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Dont waste your time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Pantage Hotel is visually appealing, but the staff will quickly change your positive first impression. Every single person I ran into in this hotel was not friendly, not smiling and miserable. I wonder if there is a problem with Management? Rooms are nice, lobby is chic, but the staff need to be replaced. I would likely not recommend this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Pantages Hotel Toronto Centre
HotelInfo.Address: 200 Victoria Street, Toronto, Ontario M5B 1V8 , Canada
